question: Who among the following personalities won the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award 2021 for contribution to Manipuri Dance? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Thokchom Ibemubi Devi. The Manipuri Dance, also referred to as the Manipuri Raas Leela, is anchored in the Vaishnava faith of the Meiteis. The four Jhaveri sisters (Nayana, Ranjana, Suverna and Darshana) are classical Manipuri dancers. Bhuvan Kumar (Chhau Dancer)

question: Asghari Bai is primarily remembered for her contribution to which of the following genres of music? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Dhrupad. Awards of Asghari Bai - Padma Shri (1990), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1986). Other Dhrupad Artists: Ramakant Gundecha, Umakant Gundecha, Zia Fariddudin Dagar, Pelva Naik, Pandit Ram Kumar Mallick, Mukund Dev Sahoo, Uday Bhawalkar.

question: Who among the following personalities was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award 2020 for his/her contribution to contemporary dance? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Bhushan Lakandri. Sangeet Natak Akademi Award: First Awarded - 1952. Awarded for - Performing arts in India. Organiser - Ministry of Culture, Government of India. Headquarters - New Delhi.

question: Who among the following personalities is associated with synthesising classical and modern Indian dance through a theatre group called Ranga Sri Little Ballet Troupe ? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Shanti Bardhan - A junior colleague of Uday Shankar, produced some of the most imaginative dance -dramas of the 20th century. He produced Ramayana, in which the actors moved and danced like puppets.

question: Who among the following personalities coined the term 'Odissi' for Odisha's classical dance? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Kabichandra Kalicharan Patnaik. His Contribution was in the field of Odissi music, Odissi dance and Odia theatre. Some of his major published works: Kalanka Bhanjana, Milana Madhuri, Daridrya Bhanjana.

question: Who among the following personalities is a professional Kuchipudi Dancer ? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Kaushalya Reddy. Famous Kuchipudi Dancers: Bhavana Reddy, Yamini Reddy, Vempati Chinna Satyam, Manju Bhargavi.

question: In 2018, Google Doodle celebrated the 100th birthday of Mrinalini Sarabhai. She is an exponent of which of the following dance forms? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Bharatanatyam and Kathakali. Awards of Mrinalini Sarabhai - Padma Shri (1965), Padma Bhushan (1992), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1970), Dhirubhai Thakar Savyasachi Saraswat Award (2014), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1994). She was the founder of Darpana Academy of Performing Arts (1949).

question: Guru Bipin Singh, a Nrityacharya awardee, Sangeet Natak Akademi awardee and Kalidas Samman awardee, was renowned for promoting which classical dance form? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Manipuri. Awards of Guru Bipin Singh - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Kalidas Samman (1989), Title of Hanjaba by the Maharaja of Manipur.

question: Urmila Satyanarayanan is an exponent of which Indian classical dance form ? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Bharatanatyam. Urmila Satyanarayanan (Tamil Nadu) - Awards: Kalaimamani award (1997), Nritya Choodamani (2001).

question: Satyaram Reang received the Padma Shri for promoting the Hojagiri dance form. He belongs to which of the following states? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Tripura. His Awards - Padma Shri (2021), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1986), Hojagiri dance (Reang community).

question: Who among the following Indian classical tabla players was called 'Abbaji'? He collaborated with American jazz drummer Buddy Rich to create a music album in 1968 ? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Alla Rakha. He belongs to Punjab Gharana. Awards: Padma Shri (1977) and Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1982).

question: Shivaputra Siddaramaiah Komkali math is the original name of which of the following Indian classical singers? SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Pandit Kumar Gandharva. Awards - Padma Vibhushan (1990). Pandit Jasraj (Rasraj) - Mewati Gharana.

question: Pandit Kishan Maharaj of Benaras Gharana was a __________ player. SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Tabla. Awards of Kishan Maharaj - Padma Shri (1973), Padma Vibhushan (2002).

question: Ustad Hassu Khan was one of the founders of which of the following Gharanas of music? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Gwalior Gharana: Oldest khayal gharana. Singers - Vishnu Digambar Paluskar, Nisaar Husain Khan, Ulhas Kashaalkar. Gharanas and their founders: Rampur - Ustad Inayat Hussain Khan, Agra - Hajisujan Khan, Kirana - Abdul Karim Khan.

question: Ramkrishna Talukdar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2018 for his contribution to the Sattriya dance form. To which state does this dance form belong? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Assam. Ramkrishna Talukdar : Awards - Asom Gaurav, Sangeet Jyoti Award, Nritya Ratna, Kala Gaurav. It was given the status of a classical dance in 2000 by the Sangeet Natak Akademi.

question: Who was the founder of Benaras Gharana of Kathak? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Janaki Prasad. Notable dancers - Sitara Devi, Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana. Ishwari Prasad - Founder of the Lucknow Gharana; Notable dancer - Pandit Birju Maharaj. Shambhu Maharaj - Celebrated Guru of the Lucknow Gharana.

question: Which danseuse among the following was called to perform for Queen Elizabeth-ll's coronation festivities in 1953 ? Graduate Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Kamala Lakshmi Narayanan (Bharatanatyam). Awards - Padma Bhushan (1970), Lifetime Achievement Award (2004), Natya Padmam (2007), Platinum Jubilee Award (2002).

question: Vasundhara Doraswamy was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (Akademi Puraskar) for the year 2019 for her contribution to which of the following ? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu). She is the only Bharatanatyam danseuse to have been invited from India to perform for ‘WORLD PEACE’ conference in Paris under the aegis of UNESCO. She was honoured with "Shantala Natya Sri Award" - The highest State Award for Dance by the Karnataka State Government and the Rajyotsava Award (Karnataka State).

question: Which dancer was the first person from Odisha to get Padma Vibhushan in 2000 ? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra. Awards - Padma Bhushan (1988), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Kalidas Samman (1987).

question: Jyoti Prasad Agarwala was a music composer popularly called 'Rupkonwar' in the state of _________ . Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Assam. Jyoti Prasad Agarwal - First filmmaker of Assam. He made the first Assamese Movie - ‘Joymoti’ (1935). His Famous Play - ‘Sonit - Konwari’, ‘Rupalim’, ‘Karengar Ligiri’, ‘Lobhita’ and 'Joymoti’. His death anniversary (17 January) is observed as ‘Silpi Divas’ in Assam.

question: The noted danseuse Yamini Krishnamurthy opened Yamini School of Dance in_________, in the year 1990. Higher Secondary 28/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Delhi. Yamini Krishnamurthy - Awards - Padma Shri (1968), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1997), Padma Bhushan (2001), Padma Vibhushan (2016), "Natya Shastra" award (2014). Autobiography - "A Passion For Dance".

question: Who among the following personalities has received both Grammy and Oscar awards? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Gulzar (Sampooran Singh Kalra) is a famous lyricist of Hindi films. Awards - National Film Award (1991, 1988). Filmfare Award (2021, 2019, 2013). Academy Award (2009). Padma Bhushan (2004). Jawed Akhtar : Poet and lyricist and screenwriter of Hindi films. Award : Padma Shri (1999), Padma Bhushan (2007).

question: Ratikant Mohapatra, an awardee of 'Sangeet Natak Akademi Award', is known for which of the following classical dances of India? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Odissi (2016). Other Awards : Bhumiputra Samman (2016), Nritya Choodamani (2014). Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (Odissi) - Pankaj Charan Das (1970), Deba Prasad Das (1970), Mayadhar Raut (1985), Sonal Mansingh (1987), Kumkum Mohanty (1994), Gangadhar Pradhan (1997), Gita Mahalik (2009), Aruna Mohanty (2010), Sujata Mohapatra (2017), Surupa Sen (2018), Sutapa Talukdar (2019), Rabindra Atibudhi (2020).

question: Kamalini and Nalini Asthana, the dancer duo have been conferred with the Padma Shri in 2022. They are renowned for which of the following dance forms? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Kathak. Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana (Agra, Uttar Pradesh) known for their performances of the Benaras Gharana style of Kathak.

question: Surupa Sen is a famous _________ dancer. Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Odissi. Awards of Surupa Sen: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2018), Raza Foundation Award (2006).

question: Who was the recipient of Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar 2017 for www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK Kathak ? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Vidha Lal. She is a disciple of Kathak dancer Geetanjali Lal of Jaipur Gharana. Awards: ‘Sri Krishna gana sabha endowment award (2010) and Guinness world record for the most number of spins (103) in one minute (2011).

question: Papanasam Sivan was related to the following music? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Carnatic. Papanasam Sivan Awards: Padma Bhushan (1972), Sangeet Natak Academy Fellow (1962), President Award (1962).

question: Who among the following musicians was awarded a Grammy in the Music Album category for his collaborative album ‘Global Drum Project’ along with Mickey Hart, Sikiru Adepoju and Giovanni Hidalgo ? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Zakir Hussain. He is the son of Ustad Alla Rakha. Awards - Padma Shri (1988), Padma Bhushan (2002), Padma vibhushan (2023) National Heritage Fellowship (1999), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1990), Kalidas Samman (2006), Guru Gangadhar Pradhan Lifetime Achievement Award (In 2012 at Konark Dance & Music Festival), Grammy Award (1992 and 2009).

question: Ilyas Khan was born in Lucknow to a family of musicians. He was famous for playing SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Sitar. Ilyas Khan (1924-1989) - He was a disciple of Abdul Ghani Khan (a dhrupad singer from Kalpi). His father belonged to the Shahjahanpur gharana of sarod players while his mother came from the Lucknow gharana of sarod players.

question: Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan was best known for which of the following instruments? SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Tabla. Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan (Delhi gharana). Awards - Padma Shri Award in 2003. Famous Tabla players - Zakir Hussain, Trilok Gurtu, Kishan Maharaj, Alla Rakha, Aban Mistry.

question: Who among the following was awarded the Bharat Ratna in 2001 and has been credited with taking the shehnai from the marriage mandap to the concert hall ? SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Bismillah Khan (Ustad). Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1994), Swathi Sangeetha Puraskaram (1998) by Government of Kerala, T Choudayya National Award (1995) by Government of Karnataka, Tahar Mausique from the Republic of Iran (1992), Tansen Award by Govt. of Madhya Pradesh.

question: Ustaad Allauddin Khan, a famous Indian musician is associated with __________ musical instrument. SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Sarod. Awards - Padma Bhusan (1958), Padma Vibhushan (1971), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1954).

question: Saswati Sen is the proud recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 2004-2005. She is recognized for which dance form? SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Kathak. Saswati Sen was a senior disciple of Pandit Birju Maharaj.

question: Saroja Vaidyanathan received Kalidas Samman for classical dance in________. SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 2009 - 10. Saroja Vaidyanathan (Bharatanatyam). Her awards: Padma Bhushan (2013), Padma Shri (2002). Bharat Kala Sunder (2006). Book by her :- “The Science of Bharatanatyam”. The first recipients (1980) of the Kalidas Samman - Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer (Classical music) and Mallikarjun Mansur (Classical Music).

question: Lata Mangeshkar recorded her first playback song for a _________ film. SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Marathi. Lata Mangeshkar - She recorded her first song “Naachu Ya Gade, Khelu Saari Mani Haus Bhaari” in 1942 at age of 13 for Marathi film Kiti Hasaal and recorded her last song ‘Saugandh Mujhe Is Mitti Ki’ in 2019.

question: Alla Rakha left home at age 12 to learn a musical instrument under the great master (ustad) Mian Qadir Baksh. He became a renowned player of ________. SSC MTS 12/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Tabla. Alla Rakha specialized in Hindustani classical music. He was born in Ghagwal (Jammu and Kashmir). He is a player of Tabla and Pakhawaj. Awards: Padma Shri (1977) and Sangeet Natak Akademi (1982).

question: Who popularised the ‘Pandanallur Style’ in Bharatanatyam and received Padma Bhusan in 2004? SSC MTS 15/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Alarmel Valli. She was the second youngest dancer to be conferred the Padma Shri (in 1991) from the Government of India, after Vyjayanthimala .

question: Who among the following is a celebrated sarod maestro? SSC MTS 15/05/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Zarin Sharma - She was a famous Sarod player of Khayal (Agra gharana). AwardS - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1988), Maharashtra Gaurav Puraskar (1990), Dadasaheb Phalke Academy award (2007).

question: Vidushi Sharan Rani is famous for playing which musical instrument? SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Sarod. She is the first woman sarod player in India. She was awarded Padma Bhushan in 2000.

question: "Bombay" Ramnath is a famous____singer of India. SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Carnatic. Bombay Jayashri Ramnath (Padma Shri in 2021) has sung in multiple languages including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada. Famous Carnatic singer - M. S. Subbulakshmi, S. Sowmya, M Balamuralikrishna, Nithyasree Mahadevan. Famous folk singers: Mame Khan, Swaroop Khan, Ila Arun, Nooran Sisters, The Wadali Brothers, Malini Awasthi, Dipali Borthakur, Kollangudi Karuppayee. Famous jazz singers: Shankar-Jaikishan, Trilok Gurtu, Louiz Banks. Famous hip-hop singers: Divine, Naezy, Raja Kumari, Brodha V.

question: Who among the following was awarded the prestigious title of "Nrityacharya' conferred by the Maharaja of Manipur? SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Guru Bipin Singh.

question: Who is noted as a pristine Indian Classical Dancer to perform at Salzburg Festival in 2015? SSC MTS 19/05/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Alarmel Valli : An exponent of the Pandanallur style of Bharatanatyam. Awards - Padma Bhushan (2004), Chevalier of Arts and Letters award (2004), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2001).

question: Jayanthi Kumaresh is one of the foremost exponents of ________. SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Veena. Jayanthi Kumaresh is known for her mastery of the Saraswati veena, a plucked string instrument that is one of the most important instruments in Carnatic music. Awards - Sangeet shikhar samman award (2019); Music academy award (2015).

question: In 2019, the Government of India honoured Milena Salvini, an Italian-born Kathakali dancer, with which of the following awards? SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Padma Shri. Milena Salvini - Obtained a two-year scholarship to train in Kathakali at the Kerala Kalamandalam in 1962.

question: Nahid Siddiqui was awarded Milapfest's Lifetime Achievement Award in October 2017. She is recognized for which dance form? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Kathak. Nahid Siddiqui (born in Pakistan), A disciple of two great teachers: Maharaj Kathak (Pakistan) and Birju Maharaj. Other Awards - Pride of Performance (1994), Time Out Award (1991), British Cultural Award, International Dance Award.

question: Which famous female personality received the Padma Shri award for Manipuri classical dance? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.correct_answer: C. Elam Endira Devi (d) Charu Mathur
solution.explanation: Elam Endira Devi (Manipur). She is an Indian classical dancer and teacher. She performed in the film ‘Matamgi Manipur’, which won the National Film Award (1972). Other awards - Excellence Award, Nritya Rani Upadhi, Best Actress Award.

question: Indore gharana is one of the vocal gharanas of Indian classical music. It was founded by _______. SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Ustad Amir Khan. Other disciples of Indore gharana - Pandit Amarnath, Shankar Lal Mishra, Kankana Banerjee, Purvi Mukherjee. Other gharana and its founder - Gwalior Khayal style (Ustad Nathan Pir Baksh), Agra (Hajisujan Khan), Rangeela (Faiyyaz Khan), Jaipur (Alladiya Khan).

question: Who among the following is a sitar maestro of global acclaim? SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Shahid Parvez Khan. Awards - Kalajyothi Lifetime Achievement Award (2020), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2006), Padma Shri Award (2012).

question: Which former Miss India, also the recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award, popularised Indian classical dance in the west? SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Indrani Rahman. She was the first South Asian to compete in the Miss Universe pageant (1952). Indrani was a successful classical dancer in Bharatanatyam, Kuchipudi, Kathakali and Odissi. In 1961, she became the first dancer to be a part of the Asia Society tour. Awards - Femina Miss India (1952), Padma Shri (1969), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1981).

question: M.S. Gopalakrishnan mastered both Carnatic and Hindustani classical music. He was the master of _______. SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Afternoon

solution.explanation: Violin. Awards and Honours:- Padma Bhushan (2012), Padma Shri (1975), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1982), Sangeet Natak Akademi Tagore Ratna (2012), Kalaimamani (Tamil Nadu) - 1978.

question: Budhaditya Mukherjee is associated with which of the following musical instruments? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Sitar. Budhaditya Mukherjee : First-ever musician to perform at the House of Commons, London.

question: Shri Mani Prasad is associated with which form of music? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Hindustani vocal music. Pandit Mani Prasad was an Indian classical vocalist from the Kirana gharana (singing style). He was awarded Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2019. Hindustani music is the classical music of the Northern parts of the Indian subcontinent. Carnatic Music originated from Southern India, the city of Hyderabad and other Dravidian-speaking regions of India.

question: Shri Jatin Goswami received several honours for his contribution to SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Sattriya dance (Assam): Awards and Honours:- Padma Shri (2008), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2004), Silpi Divas Award (1994), Sangeet Jyoti Award (2004), Assam Natya Sanmilon Award (1997), Hiraprova - Chandrakanta Award (2006).

question: With which of the following classical dance forms is Deepika Reddy associated ? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Kuchipudi (Classical dance of Andhra Pradesh): Guru Smt. Vijaya Prasad, Shri Vedantam Lakshmi Narayana Sastry, Dr. Vempati Chinna Satyam, Yamini Krishnamurthy, Shobha Naidu, Raja and Radha Reddy, Kaushalya Reddy, Yamini Reddy, Bhavana Reddy, Atisha Pratap Singh, Arunima Kumar.

question: The poet saint Kabir Das was born in sometime in the 15th century. SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Kashi (Uttar Pradesh). Kabir was a 15th century mystic poet, saint of the Bhakti Movement. Books - Bijak, Kabir Parachai, Sakhi Granth, and Kabir Granthawali. His verses are found in Sikhism's scripture Guru Granth Sahib. Saint Kabir was the contemporary of Guru Nanak and Delhi Sultan Sikandar Lodhi.

question: Aditi Mangaldas is a leading dancer & Choreographer in the classical Indian dance form of_________. SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Kathak. Awards Received by Aditi Mangaldas - National Sangeet Natak Akademi award in 2013.

question: Who among the following was the guru of Pandit Ravi Shankar ? SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Allauddin Khan (Sarod player) was the guru of Pandit Ravi Shankar. He was awarded the Padma Bhushan (1958) and the Padma Vibhushan (1971), Sangeet Natak Akademi award and Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1954).

question: In which state is the Maihar court where Baba Allauddin Khan was a musician? SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. Baba Allauddin Khan (Sarod player) laid the foundation of Maihar Gharana and became the court musician for the Maharaja of Maihar.

question: Who among the following is known as a pioneering dance educationist and a prominent Mohiniyattam exponent ? SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Dr. Kanak Rele. She is the founder-director of the Nalanda Dance Research Centre (1967) and the founder-principal of the Nalanda Nritya Kala Mahavidyalaya in Mumbai. Awards and Honors: Padma Shri (1990), Kalidas Samman (Madhya Pradesh, 2006), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1994), Padma Bhushan (2013).

question: Rajashree Shirke was given which of the following prestigious dance awards of 2013 for her excellence in Kathak? SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Sangeet Natak Academy Award. Awards and Honors: Mumbai Mayor's Award for Women Achievers of the Year, Best Shikshak for the year 2007, and Title "Khosrovani" by Halim Academy of Sitar. Shambhu Maharaj was the first Kathak dancer to win Sangeet Natak Academy Award in 1955.

question: Who among the following Indian classical musicians has an auditorium named after it in Tehran, Iran? SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Ustad Bismillah Khan (shehnai) - Become the third classical musician of India after M. S. Subbalakshmi and Ravi Shankar to be awarded the Bharat Ratna (2001).

question: Who among the following was the first recipient of the State annual award Nishagandhi Puraskaram from the Government of Kerala in 2013? SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Mrinalini Sarabhai was the founder and director of Darpana Academy of Performing Arts in Ahmedabad.

question: Shovana Narayan was awarded which of the following awards in 2013 ? SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Guru Deba Prasad. Awards and Honors: Oisca Award (Japan) (1990–91), Dadabhai Naoroji Award (1993), Bihar Gaurav Puraskar (1985), Guru ML Koser Award (2013), Art Karat Award (2014), Bharat Nirman’s Social Responsibility Award (2014) etc.

question: Who among the following is a famous performer of the Kathakali classical dance? SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Gopinath. Awards and Honors: Sangeet Natak Akademi's award (1965), 'Kala Tilakam' by the Guruvayur Devaswom (1968), 'Kala RatIn’ title by the Travancore Devaswom Board (1973), etc.

question: Rajkumar Singhajit Singh, a leading exponent and guru of Indian classical Manipuri dance form, was awarded which of the following Indian civilian honours in 1986? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Padma Shri. Rajkumar Singhajit Singh (Manipuri dancer). Awards and Honors - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1984), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (2011), Tagore Award (2014), Delhi Sahitya Kala Parishad Award (1975), Manipur Sahitya Parishad Nritya Award (1975), etc.

question: Which of the following Gharanas does Padma Bhushan Kishori Amonkar belong to? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Jaipur - Atrauli. Kishori

question: Who among the following personalities is an exponent of Kathak dance in India? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Prerana Shrimali. She is a senior dancer of Jaipur Gharana of Kathak. Honours - 2001 Rashtriya Ekta Award (57th Birth Anniversary of Rajiv Gandhi).

question: Guru Nileshwar Mukherjee is the exponent of which of the following Indian classical dance forms? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Manipuri.

question: With which instrument do the sisters Lalita and Nandini identify? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Violin. Awards and Honors: `Kalaimamani’ (Tamil Nadu), Title of `Haratha Violin Vadya Thilakangal’, Best senior violinist (Madras music academy, and Indian fine arts society). Violinist in India: Mysore brothers – Mysore Nagaraj and Mysore Manjunath, Abhijith P. S. Nair, Ambi Subramaniam, B. Sasikumar, Balabhaskar Chandran, Embar Kannan, H. K. Narasimhamurthy, Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi, etc.

question: Who was the recipient of the National Devdasi Award in 2016? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Prerana Deshpande (Kathak). Gaurav Puruskar at the hands of Pt. Birju Maharaj, Singar Mani title, by the Sur Singar Samsad of Mumbai, Nrityashree title, Kiran, Katan (1994). R MuthuKannammal (Sadir dancer) - Padma Shri (2022).

question: Name the classical dancer who was given the Prani Mitra Award in 1968. SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Rukmini Devi Arundale (Bharatanatyam). Awards: Padma Bhushan (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1957).

question: Who among the following is NOT an exponent of Mohiniyattam classical dance form? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Prateeksha Kashi (Kuchipudi dancer). Awards and honours: Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar (2014), Aditya Vikram Birla Kalakiran Puraskar (2014), Aryabhata International Award (2011), Kalabharathi National Young Talent Award (2014), Natyaveda Award (2014). Kalamandalam Kalyanikutty Amma: Mother of Mohiniyattam.

question: Surekha Punekar is a _________ dancer from the Indian state of Maharashtra. SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Lavani. Vithabai Narayangaonkar, Kantabai Satarkar, Mangala Bansode, Sandhya Mane, Roshan Satarkar are well known artists presenting Lavani on stage.

question: Which of the following was awarded to Bharatnatyam dancer Priyadarshini Govind in 1998 ? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Kalaimamani. Other Awards - ‘Nritya Kalanidhi' title by The Music Academy in 2019, Sangeet Natak Akademi award (2012).

question: Kumkum Mohanty, an Odissi dancer received which of the following awards in 2005? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Padma Shri. Guru Kelucharan Mahapatra Award (2011), Odisha Sangeet Natak Akademi (1993). Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1994).

question: Sharmila Biswas, who was awarded the 'Best Choreography Award' in 1998 by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, represents which of the following classical dance forms? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Sharmila Biswas (Odissi dancer and choreographer) established Odissi Vision and Movement Center (1995, Kolkata). Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2012), Uday Shankar Award for Best Choreography (1998), Mahari Award (2010).

question: With which instrument is Ustad Sultan Khan associated? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Sarangi. He was one of the founding members of the Tabla Beat Science (Indian Fusion group) with Zakir Hussain and Bill Laswell. Awards: Padma Bhushan (2010), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1992), American Academy of Artists (1998).

question: Who among the following teamed up with flautist Hariprasad Chaurasia and guitarist Brij Bhushan Kabra and produced a concept album, 'Call of the Valley' (1967)? SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Pandit Shivkumar Sharma (santoor player).

question: Who among the following is Telangana’s first Sangeet Natak Akademi Award winner ? SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Padmaja Reddy (Kuchipudi). She developed Kakatiyam (a two-part Kuchipudi classical visual dance form). Awards: Kala Ratna (2006), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2015), and Padma Shri (2022). Sangeet Natak Academy: Founded (1953), Headquarters (New Delhi).

question: Who among the following was popularly called the ‘Australian Mother of Kathakali’? SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (2nd Shift) www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK

solution.explanation: Louise Lightfoot was popularly called the Australian Mother of Kathakali by Vallathol Narayana Menon (the founder of Kerala Kalamandalam). Kathakali is known as the ballad of the East. It is performed on the Sopana sangeet.

question: Who among the following has the credit to invent and create a new style of ‘Bharatanatyam’ ? SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam: Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1983), Padma Bhushan (2003) Padma Shri (1981).

question: Which Gharana was propounded by Bade Fateh Ali Khan and Ali Baksh Jarnail Khan? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Patiala Gharana. Malika Pukhraj, Gauhar Jan, Ghulam Ali are all related to Patiala Gharana. Gwalior Gharana : Ghulam Hassan Shaggan, Vasundhara Komkali, Narayanrao Bodas, Sunanda Patnaik. Agra Gharana : Yaqoob Hussain Khan, Yusuf Hussain Khan, Khurshid Hussain Khan, Shamim Ahmed Khan, Ghulam Rasool Khan. Bhendi Bazaar Gharana : Pandit Shivkumar Shukla, Ramesh Nadkarni, T.D. Janorikar. Tansen belonged to Gwalior Gharana.

question: Violin virtuoso L Subramaniam is famous for which of the following genres of music globally? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Carnatic music. Padma Shri (1988), Padma Bhushan (2001), Manaviyam (Millennium) Award, Kerala (2001). Popular Violists : Abhijith P. S. Nair, Ambi Subramaniam, Arrol Carelli, Avaneeswaram S R Vinu, B. Sasikumar, Ragini Shankar.

question: The famous musician, Appa Jalgaonkar is associated with which musical instrument? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Harmonium - Appa Jalgaonkar (Sangeet Natak Akademi Award - 2000). It is also called Reed Organ, a free-reed keyboard instrument. Famous Harmonium players - Mehmood Dhaulpuri, R. K. Bijapure, Sudhir Nayak, Tulsidas Borkar.

question: Hari Prasad Chaurasia, an Indian flutist, is associated with which of the following music gharanas? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Senia gharana (Founder - Bilas Khan and Naubat Khan). Official Biography of Hari Prasad Chaurasia - 'Breath of Gold' (2019) by Sathya Saran. Other famous flutists - Ronu Majumdar, Pravin Godkhindi, Raghunath Seth. Other Gharana - Agra (Hajisujan Khan), Lucknow (Bindadin Maharaj), Banaras (Pandit Ram Sahai), Jaipur (Ustad Alladiya Khan).

question: Which extraordinary scholar and artist of the 17th century AD composed Bhaamaakalaapam, a dance drama based on Kuchipudi? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Siddhendra Yogi. Bhama Kalapam (story of Satyabhama, wife of the god Krishna). Most popular classical dance-dramas, Kathakali (sage Bharata).

question: The famous musician Satyadev Pawar is associated with which musical instrument? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Violin. Other Violin Players - Lalgudi Jayaraman - Padma Shri (1963), Padam Bhushan (1994), Sangeet Natak Akademi (2010); L. Subramaniam {Padma Shri (1998) Padma Bhushan (2001); M. S Gopalakrishnan {Padma Shri (1975), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1982), Padma Bhushan (2012)}.

question: Mallika Sarabhai was honoured by the________government with Chevalier des Palmes Academiques 2005. SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: French. Mallika Sarabhai (Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi dancer ) - Padma Bhushan (2010). Book - In Free Fall: My Experiments With Living. Founder of Darpana dance Academy.

question: The Sabri brothers, Aziz Warsi and Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan are associated with which singing style? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Qawwali. Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan (President of Pakistan Award for Pride of Performance by the Government of Pakistan). Indian folk music - Bhavageethe (Karnataka and Maharashtra), Bhangra and Giddha (Punjab), Lavani (Maharashtra). Alha (Madhya Pradesh) and Panihari, Pankhida and Maand (Rajasthan).

question: Who among the following was a famous sitar player ? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Nikhil Banerjee (Maihar Gharana). Awards - Padma Shri (1968), Padma Bhushan (1987). Hari Prasad Chaurasia (Flute Player), Zakir Hussain (Tabla Player). The Sangeet Sudarshana states that the sitar was invented during the 18th century by a fakir named Amir Khusru.

question: Laxmipriya Mohapatra was associated with which of the following classical dances of India ? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Odissi. Laxmipriya Mohapatra is said to be the first woman to perform Gotipua (folk dance of Odisha) on stage, and the first dancer to perform Odissi on stage.

question: Ileana Citaristi is the first classical dancer of foreign origin who was conferred the Padma Shri Award in 2006 for her contributions to ________. SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Odissi. Ileana Citaristi is an Indian Odissi and Chhau dancer. Awards: 43rd National Film Awards (1996), Padma Shri (2006), Leonide Massine for the Art of Dance (Italy, 1992), Sanskriti Siromani

question: Who was hailed as the ‘Tansen of the 20th century’? Higher Secondary 01/08/2022 (Shift - 3 )

solution.correct_answer: D. Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan
solution.explanation: Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan (Patiala gharana). Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1962), Sangeet Natak Akademi fellow (1967), Padma Bhushan Award (1962). Ustad Abdul Karim Khan (founder of the Kairana gharana of classical music). Ustad Faiyaz Khan (exponent of the Agra gharana). Ustad Amir Khan (founder of the Indore gharana of Classical Music).

question: Who among the following dancers was awarded the Queen Victoria Silver Medal of the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, London in 1958 ? Graduate Level 01/08/2022 (Shift - 4 )

solution.explanation: Rukmini Devi Arundale (Bharatanatyam). Awards: Padma Bhushan (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1957), Prani Mitra Award (1968).

question: Who achieved fame for the Pandanallur school of Bharatanatyam? Graduate Level 02/08/2022 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Meenakshi Pillai. Other two prominent styles of Bharatanatyam (classical dance, Tamil Nadu) are Vazhuvoor Dance Form (Vazhuvoor B. Ramiah Pillai and his ancestors) and Melattur Dance form (Guru Mangudi Dorairaj).

question: Tankeswar Hazarika Borbayan received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year 2018 for his contribution to which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Sattriya dance (Assam).

question: Madhavi Mudgal is associated with which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Odissi. Awards : Sanskriti Award (1984), Padma Shri (1990), Orissa State Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1996), Grande Medaille de la Ville by Govt. of France (1997), Central Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2000), Delhi State Parishad Samman (2002) and the title of Nritya Choodamani in 2004.

question: With which of the following was Kadri Gopalnath associated ? SSC MTS 08/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Saxophone. Famous Saxophone players in India - Manohari Singh, Allah Rakha Rahman, Braz Gonsalves, Adnan Sami Khan, George Brooks, etc. The saxophone is a type of single-reed woodwind instrument with a conical shape, usually made of brass.

question: Radha Sridhar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year 2018 for her contribution to which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 08/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Bharatnatyam. She established Venkatesha Natya Mandira in 1969. She choreographed her first dance-drama based on the Ramayana, followed by Hanumadvilasa.

question: Dr N Rajam is known for playing the ________. SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Violin. Popular Violinist in India: Abhijith P. S. Nair, B. Sasikumar, Harikumar Sivan, Embar Kannan, Kala Ramnath, Sunita Bhuyan, Akkarai Subbalakshmi, Vittal Ramamurthy, Ragini Shankar, Manoj George, Gagan Chandra Chatterjee, Sangeeta Shanka etc

question: Who is the first trans woman to win a Padma Shri award for Bharatanatyam? SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Narthaki Nataraj. Kalaimamani Award of Tamil Nadu Government in 2007, Nritya Choodamani Award from Krishna Gana Sabha in 2009, Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2011, Vetri Award from University of Madras in 2013. Honorary Doctorate from Periyar Maniammai University 2016, ICCR Empanelled Dance Artist in Outstanding Category 2017.

question: Pandit Rajendra Gangani is associated with which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Kathak Dance. Pandit Rajendra Gangani: Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2003). He is one of the leading exponents of the Jaipur Gharana style of Kathak.

question: His compositions for blockbusters such as Silsila and Chandni are a manifestation of his musical brilliance. Who is he? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Pandit Shivkumar Sharma. He was awarded Platinum Disc for music of film Silsila, Gold Disc for music of film Faasle, Platinum Disc for music of film Chandni.

question: Minati Mishra was associated with which classical dance of India? SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Odissi. Minati Mishra was a recipient of the 1975 Orissa Sangeet Natak Akademi Award. She also received the Kalinga Shastriya Sangeet Parishad Award and in 2000, she received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award. In 2012, the Government of India awarded her the Padma Shri, the fourth-highest civilian award of India.

question: Chitti Babu is associated with which musical instrument? SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Veena. Famous Veena players in India - Zia Mohiuddin Dagar, Ayyagari Syamasundaram, Doraiswamy Iyengar, Emani Sankara Shastri, Dhanammal, KR Kumaraswamy, Sundaram Balachandrer, etc.

question: Yog Sunder Desai, a pioneer who ventured into the world of Indian Dance www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK in the pre-independence era, was born on July 16, 1921 in __________. SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Gujarat. Yog Sunder Desai directed the 'Ram Lila' for Shriram Bharatiya Kala Kendra in 1966. Yog Sunder founded his dance ensemble in 1948 in Calcutta and called it the Indian Revival Group in the spirit of revivalism that was sweeping the country.

question: ________ along with his wife, herself a dancer, and their son built Srjan in 1993. SSC CHSL 24/05/ 2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Kelucharan Mohapatra. He is an exponent of Odissi Dance. he choreographed a number of dance - dramas in Odissi style, including "Panchapuspa", "Krushna Gatha", "Geeta Govinda", "Urbashi", "Krushna Leela", "Sakhigopal", "Konark" and "Sri Kshetra".

question: The Nooran Sisters are renowned for which of the following genres of Indian Music? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Sufi. The Nooran Sisters (Jyoti Nooran and Sultana Nooran) are a Sufi singing duo from Jalandhar, India. They perform Sham Chaurasia gharana classical music.

question: Which of the following Hindustani vocalists from Allahabad, along with her famed contemporary Gauhar Jaan, had the privilege of performing for Emperor George V at the Delhi Darbar in 1911 ? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Janki Bai. She was popularly known as “Chhappan chhuri” or the 'woman with 56 stab wounds'. Shobha Abhyankar (Pune) - Mewati Gharana. Annupamaa (Chennai)- Carnatic Music, Allah Jilai Bai (Rajasthan) - Folk Music.

question: Padma Shri awardee Gopal Prasad Dubey was awarded for his contribution to which of the following dances? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Chhau. Awards: Padma Shri (2012), Suvarna Shankhu (2010), Natya Shri title from Nataraj Music Academy (2010).

question: Who is the first Indian musician to win the Oscar award for Best Original Score? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: AR Rahman. Resul Pookutty won an oscar award for best sound mixing. Bhanu Athaiya won an Oscar for costume design for her work on “Gandhi”. Mehboob Khan was the Director of the movie Mother India which was nominated in the best foreign film category.

question: Shamshad Begum, one of the first women to sing playback for Hindi movies, was conferred with the prestigious OP Nayyar Award for her contribution to Hindi film Music in the year _____. SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 2009. Award: Padma Bhushan (2009).

question: Meenakshi Srinivasan received the Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar 2011 for which of the following dance forms? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Bharatanatyam. In 2018 (Last Awarded) - Durgesh Gangani (Kathak), Dr Manju Elangbam (Manipuri), Madhulita Mohapatra (Odissi) .

question: Which of the following dancers of Mohiniyattam form of Indian classical dance was given the Devadasi National Award in 2013? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Jayaprabha Menon. Prerana Deshpande, a kathak dancer, has been awarded the Devadasi National Award for her contribution to Kathak dance in 2016.

question: Padma Shri awardee Guru Amubi Singh was conferred the award for his significant contributions in which of the following dance forms ? SSC CHSL 25/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Manipuri. Padma Shri (1970), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1956).

question: Due to the service done by the poet ___________, the Kathakali dance form received a new impetus and today, many innovations are also being made to suit the needs of a changing society. SSC CHSL 25/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Vallathol Narayana Menon was a poet in the Malayalam Language. His famous poem is "Ente Gurunathan" ("My Great Teacher"). He was one of the triumvirate poets of modern Malayalam, along with Kumaran Asan and Ulloor S. Parameswara Iyer.

question: Padma Shri awardee Guru Gangadhar Pradhan is an accomplished dancer of which of the following dance forms ? SSC CHSL 25/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Odissi. He was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1998 and the Padma Shri (India's fourth highest civilian award) in 2008.

question: Who among the following versatile musicians of India won the Best Music Director National Award for the Hindi movie ‘Rudaali’ and was also known as the ‘Bard of Brahmaputra’? SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Bhupen Hazarika. He received Bharat Ratna Award in 2019. He is from Assam.

question: Ashish Sankrityayan is an exponent of _________ music. SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Dhrupad. In Hindustani music, there are ten main singing styles: Dhrupad, Tappa, Chaturang, Ragasagar, Dhamar, Hori, Khayal, Tarana, Sargam, and Thumri. Every composition in the Carnatic style is made up of several parts: Pallavi, Anu Pallavi, Varnam and Ragamalika.

question: The nineteenth century saw the www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK golden age of Kathak under the patronage of Wajid Ali Shah, the last Nawab of __________. SSC CHSL 26/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Oudh. He patronised the Lucknow Gharana of Kathak.

question: Shobana Chandrakumar, a recipient of Padma Shri, is a dancer of which of the following Indian classical dance forms? SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Bharatnatyam. Padma Shri (2006). She won the Kalaimamani (Tamil Nadu) award in 2011. She won the Kalarathna (Kerala) award in 2013.

question: The first recipient of the National Award for Best Music Direction was _______ who was honoured for his composition in the Tamil film Kandan Karunai. SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: K. V. Mahadevan. He was again awarded the same in 1979 for Sankarabharanam (Telugu film). National Award for Best Music Direction 2019: D. Imman was awarded for Viswasam (Tamil film).

question: In which of the following years did Pandit Bhimsen Gururaj Joshi give his first ever live performance? SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 1941. Pandit Bhimsen Gururaj Joshi was one of the greatest Indian vocalists from Karnataka and belongs to the Kirana gharana tradition of the Hindustani classical tradition. He gave his first live performance in 1941 at the age of 19.

question: Who among the following Khayal singers of the 19th century was given the title of ‘Tanras” by Bahadur Shah Jaffar, the last Mughal Emperor of India? SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Meer Qutub Baksh. He was also a member of the Qawwal Bachchon Ka Delhi Gharana. His tomb in Hyderabad is near Khamas Shah Dargah. Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan (vocalist, from Patiala Gharana), Ustad Amir Khan (founder of the Indore gharana) and Sadarang (Khayal Gharana).

question: Who among the following Indian Playback Singers holds the Guinness world record for singing the highest number of songs in one day? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Kumar Sanu holds the Guinness world record for singing the highest number of 28 songs in one day in 1993. Honours- Maharashtra Ratna Awards (2014), Mahanayak Samman Lifetime Achievement: as Bengali Playback Singer (2014), Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Nobel Award (2017), Bishesh Sangeet Mahasanman (2019).

question: Padma Shri Guru Mayadhar Raut’s pioneering spirit revived which of the following dances in the 1950s and redefined the grammar and Abhinaya vocabulary of the dance form? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Odissi. Guru Mayadhar Raut: Awards- Sangeet Natak Akademi Tagore Ratna (2011), Sahitya Kala Parishad Award (1984).

question: Who among the following Hindustani classical vocalists was awarded the Padma Bhushan by the Government of India and the title of ‘Rajya Gayika’ by the Government of Maharashtra in 1969? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Kesarbai Kerkar was an Indian classical vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana. She was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1953, followed by Padma Bhushan, in 1969. The Maharashtra Government awarded her the title Maharashtra Rajya Gayika. Gangubai Hangal (Khyal, Kirana Gharana, Karnataka). Nagarathnamma (Carnatic Singer, Bangalore).

question: Who among the following Indian Carnatic musicians received the Padma Vibhushan award in 1991 and established the Academy of Performing Arts and Research in Switzerland ? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Dr. Mangalampalli Balamurali Krishna (Andhra Pradesh) was an Indian Carnatic vocalist, he also played the kanjira, mridangam, viola, and violin. He was conferred with many prestigious awards Padma Shri (1971), Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan (1991), Chevalier of the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres (2005), National Film Awards (1976, 1987), and the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1975).

question: Which artist’s musical album is titled ‘Land of Gold’ ? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Anoushka Shankar (British- Indian American Sitar player) won a Grammy nomination for her album, “Land of Gold”. Her other notable albums are RISE, Traveller, Traces of You, Home, and Love Letters. Anupama Bhagwat (Sitarist; ‘Confluence’, ‘Ether’, ‘Epiphany’, ‘Colours of Sunset’, ‘Sanjh’), Rajna Swaminathan (acclaimed mridangam artist), and Mita Nag (Sitarist from Bishnupur Gharana).

question: Famous classical dancer Vidyagauri Adkar is recognised with ______ Gharana of Indian classical dance form. SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Jaipur Gharana. Vidyagauri Adkar (Mumbai) is a Kathak dance exponent in India. Other Kathak dancers of Jaipur Gharana are Sunder Prasad (Sundar Chunnilal Prasad), Puru Dadheech, and Mangala Bhatt.

question: Guru Shyama Charan Pati, was conferred the Padma Shri for his contributions to mainly which of the following dance forms? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Chhau nritya, a martial dance form of India. He was awarded the Padma Shri, in 2006, for his contributions to Indian dance.

question: Pandit Sunder Prasad who was awarded with the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1959 was a ______ dancer. www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Kathak. Pandit Sunder Prasad was a guru (teacher) of Jaipur Gharana. He was honoured by Natak Academy of Delhi in 1958.

question: Who among the following won the first National Film Award for Best Choreography in 1992? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Laxmibai Kolhapurkar. Raju Sundaram won 67th National Award in choreography for Movie Maharshi.

question: Sartaj Khan, Sarwar Khan, Swaroop Khan and Mame Khan are famous for which of the following? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Rajasthani folk music. The most famous Rajasthani Maand singer is Allah Jilai Bai (Bikaner Gharana). Other Rajasthani folk singers are Ila Arun, Rapperiya Baalam, and Rajnigandha Shekhawat.

question: Which of the following Hindustani musical Gharanas is the oldest among all the Khayal Gayaki styles? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Gwalior vocal Gharana is widely regarded as the oldest Gharana founded by Nathan Pir Bakhsh and Utsad Nathu khan. Famous artists include Dr. Meeta Pandit, Ustad Bade Inayat Hussain Khan, Krishnarao Shankar Pandit, Narayanrao Bodas, etc. Founders of Agra Gharana (Hajisujan Khan), Kirana (Abdul Wahid Khan) and Atrauli (Alladiya Khan).

question: The important singers of _________Gharana are Faiyyaz Khan, Latafat Hussein Khan and Dinkar Kakini. SSC CHSL 31/05/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Agra Gharana is a tradition of Hindustani classical vocal music descended from the Nauhar Bani (during the reign of Emperor Alauddin Khilji of Delhi). Some prominent exponents are Faiyaz Khan “Prempiya", Vilayat Hussain Khan "Pran Piya", Khadim Hussain Khan "Sajan Piya", Sharafat Hussain Khan "Prem Rang", Shrikrishna Narayan Ratanjankar "Sujan", Babanrao Haldankar "Raspiya'', Zohrabai, etc.

question: Who among the following is known as a vocalist in Carnatic Music? SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: GN Balasubramaniam- Carnatic Vocalist. Five famous Carnatic Singers - Aruna Sairam, M. Balamuralikrishna, M. S. Subbulakshmi, Nithyasree Mahadevan, Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer etc.

question: In India, the tradition of singing ghazal was established by _________. SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Hazrat Amir Khusrau. He is called the father of qawwali. He is known as the Parrot of India. Famous Books written by him are Tughlaqnama, Nuh - sipihr and Khaizan-ul-futuh.

question: Manjamma Jogati became India’s first transgender folk dancer to receive a Padma Shri honour for her contribution to art in the year ____. SSC CHSL 01/06/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 2021. She was awarded Padma Shri for her contribution to the field of folk arts. First transgender Padma Shri Awardee (Narthaki Nataraj; Bharatnatyam dancer; 2019)

question: Who among the following wrote two books on the history and dance structure of Mohiniyattam? SSC CHSL 02/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Kalamandalam Kalyanikutty Amma. question: Bharat Muni, in his Natya Shastra, categorises musical instruments into four different parts. What is the categorisation of musical instruments by Bharat Muni based on? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Different sounds of the musical instruments. Kishan Maharaj. Flute: Hari Prasad Chaurasia, Pannalal Ghosh. Shehnai: Bismillah Khan, Krishna Ram Chaudhary. Guitar: Braj Bhushan Kabra.

question: Who among the following musicians played Carnatic music with Ghatam? Higher Secondary 26/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

question: Pandit Ram Narayan, who was awarded the Pandit Bhimsen Joshi Lifetime Achievement Award for 2015–2016, is a _______ player. Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

question: Famous musician Talvin Singh is associated with playing the____. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)

question: Neeruswamy Pillai and Rajaratanam Pillai are exponents of which musical instrument? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)

question: Who among the following Indian musicians is the inventor of Mohan Veena? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (1st Shift)

question: Ustad Akbar Ali Khan is remembered for his contribution to which of the following musical instruments? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (2nd shift)

question: RK Bijapure played which of the following musical instruments? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (3rd shift)

question: Which musical instrument Dr A P J Abdul Kalam, former President of India, used to play ? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (3rd shift)

question: Ramnad V Raghavan is associated with which of the following musical instruments? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (1st shift)

question: Totaram Sharma is associated with which of the following instruments? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (4th shift)

question: The musician Sivamani is associated with which musical instrument? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (4th shift)

question: Select the correct sequence of the musical instruments according to the given sequence of their associated personalities : Ustad Allah Rakha, Totaram Sharma, TH Vinayakam. SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Tabla, Pakhawaj, Ghatam. Tabla is the most famous percussion instrument of North India. Pakhawaj is an ancient drum, it is the preferred percussion instrument of the ancient singing style called Dhrupad. A Ghatam is a large, narrow-mouthed earthenware pot used as a percussion instrument.

question: Tansen, who was included in the Navaratnas of Akbar, was an expert in playing which of the following musical instruments? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Rabab (String instrument). Tansen (Ramtanu Pandey) - A Hindustani classical musician also known as Sangeeth Samrat or Mian (Learned One). Tansen Samaroh is celebrated every year in the month of December in Gwalior district.

question: The famous musician, Faiyaz Khan is associated with which musical instrument? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Tabla (Membranophone percussion instrument). The Maharaja of Mysore awarded him the title "Aftab - e - Mausiqi" (the Sun of Music) in 1908.

question: Select the Indian musician who is associated with percussion instruments (played by striking). SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (3rd shift)

question: Which of the following instruments is performed by Nandini and Ragini Shankar ? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Violin. Other Exponents - Jyotsna Srikanth, Abhijith P.S. Nair, L. Subramaniam, K. Vaidyanathan, Nagai R Muralidharan, Mohanan Chandrasekaran.

question: Which of the following music instruments are solid instruments? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Ghana Vadya. Solid instruments are usually played with a striker or hammer. These instruments are not capable of producing definite pitches that are required for creating a melody. That is why their use is limited in classical music. Tata Vadya - These are Stringed instruments. Avanaddha Vadya - These are percussion instruments. Sushira Vadya - These are wind instruments. The Shehnai is a popular wind instrument in India.

question: The shehnai is a reed instrument with how many holes along the tubes? SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Seven. Shehnai - It is a reed instrument in which there are seven holes along the tube which are used for playing the melody by opening and closing them with the fingers. It is known as Mangal Vadya. It is considered to have come to India from West Asia. In the early fifties of this century, Ustad Bismillah Khan is credited for popularising this instrument. Pt. Anant Lal and Pt. Daya Shankar is also a noted Shehnai player.

question: What is Tat Vadya ? SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Stringed instruments. Tata Vadya - Sound produced by vibration of a string or chord. Example - Veena, Sitar, Sarangi etc. The Percussion Instruments - Congo, Bongo, Djembe, Darbukas, Hand Drums and Tongue Drums. Idiophones or Ghana Vadya are solid instruments that do not need any further tuning. Examples - Piccolo, Manjira, Jaltarang, Jhanj and Chimta. Wind instruments - woodwinds, such as the flute, clarinet, oboe, and bassoon, also include brass instruments like horn and trumpet.

question: Flute instruments come under which type of instrument category ? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Sushira Vadya (Wind instrument). Example - Flute, Shehnai, Nadaswaram. Ghana Vadya - Considered to be the world's first instrument. It does not require tuning. Example - Manjira, Khartal, Chimta, Ghatam, Jaltarang etc. Avanaddha Vadya - Sound produced by striking on animal skin. Example - Tabla, Mridangam, Dhol, Damru etc.

question: Bickram Ghosh, a recipient of Global Indian Music Award, is a music composer and an Indian classical _________ player. SSC CHSL 27/05/2022 (Evening)

question: Pandit Ananda Gopal Bandopadhyay was a _________ player of the Banaras gharana. SSC CHSL 30/05/2022 (Evening)

question: Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri is associated with _________ instrument. SSC CHSL 10/06/2022 (Morning)

question: Which of the following is not a percussion instrument? SSC CGL 13/04/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Sarod. The percussion family of musical instruments consists of membranophones and idiophones. Examples- Ghatam, Tabla, Mridangam, timpani, xylophone, cymbals, snare drum, bass drum, tambourine, maracas, gongs, chimes, celesta, and piano. Sarod, stringed musical instrument of the lute family.

question: Which of the following musical instruments is also known as a ‘Mangal Vadya’ ? SSC CGL 19/04/2022 (Morning)

question: A distinct ‘Dhrupad style’ is associated with the ______ gharana. SSC CGL 21/04/2022 (Afternoon)

question: Which of the following instruments is normally played in a vertical position and with an arched bow? SSC MTS 08/10/2021 (Evening)

question: The musical instrument 'Kartal' from the state of Rajasthan comes under the category of ______. SSC CHSL 06/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Idiophone is a percussion instrument. It is classified as an idiophone because the entire instrument vibrates to produce a sound on its own.

question: The ______ is a single string musical instrument made using bamboo and a gourd, mostly used by traditional folk singers in Maharashtra. SSC CPO 25/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Ektara is a drone flute consisting of a gourd resonator covered with skin, through which a bamboo neck is inserted. Ektara means “one string”.

question: 'Khuang' is a traditional musical instrument of which state? SSC CHSL 20/10/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Mizoram. It is made up of a hollow tree, wrapped on both sides with animal skin.

question: The wood of which of the following trees is used to make the large plucked string instrument used in Carnatic classical music known as Bobbili Veena/Saraswathi Veena? SSC CGL 09/03/2020 (Morning)

question: The birth anniversary of Lord Jhulelal of the Sindhi community is also known as_________. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Cheti Chand marks the beginning of the Lunar Hindu New Year for Sindhi Hindus. Celebrated on the first day of the Sindhi month of Chet (Chaitra) as per the lunisolar Hindu calendar. This festival symbolizes new beginnings and holds deep spiritual significance for the Sindhi community.

question: Kharchi Puja of Tripura is celebrated in the month of __________. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: July - August. Kharchi Puja occurs during the month of ‘Ashad’ on the ‘Shukla Ashtami’ day. It is also known as the 'Festival of 14 Gods,' this traditional event centers around the worship of Chaturdasa Devata, housed in the ancient Ujjayanta Palace, the ancestral deity of the Tripuri people. Other Festivals of Tripura: Pilak, Garia Puja, Bijhu, Owa.

question: Where is the Kala Ghoda Arts Festival organised every year? SSC MTS 21/10/2024 (1st Shift)

question: Losoong festival is predominantly celebrated in Sikkim by which of the following tribes? SSC MTS 22/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

Festivals of Sikkim and Community: Barahimizong (Mangar), Sonam Lochar (Tamang), Tamu Lochar (Gurung), Teyongsi Srijunga Sawan Tongnam (Limboo).

question: ‘Dashain’ and ‘Tihar’ are popular festivals of which neighbouring country of India? SSC MTS 23/10/2024 (1st Shift)

Festivals of Nepal: Biska Jatra, Gai Jatra, Indra Jatra, Maghe Sankranti, Pahan Charhe, Chhechu. Sri Lanka - Kandy Esala Perahera, Poson Poya, Vel Festival. Bangladesh - Shakrain, Pahela Baishakh. Pakistan - Shandur Polo Festival, Mela Chiraghan, Urs of Data Ganj Bakhsh.

question: In which of the following states is Aoleang Monyü celebrated, which is an ancient spring festival celebrated by all Konyaks in the month of April? SSC MTS 23/10/2024 (1st Shift)
