This festival is celebrated annually as part of the Mini Hornbill Tribal Festival. Festivals of Nagaland: Hornbill, Sekrenyi, Moatsu Mong, Suhkruhnye, Bushu, Yemshe, Metumniu, Metemneo, Ngada, Tokhu Emong.

question: Vangpui Kut festival is organised www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK for _______ days in Mizoram to celebrate the glory of Mizo culture and traditions. SSC MTS 23/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 2. Vangpui Kut has been celebrated at Dungtlang village in Champai District since 1984. Festivals of Mizoram: Pawl Kut - It is a thanksgiving festival celebrated for 2 days after the harvest. Chapchar Kut - It is a thanksgiving festival celebrated after clearing the jungles for Jhum cultivation. Mim Kut - It is celebrated to pay respects to the departed souls of the previous year by offering them bread, maize, vegetables and other items. Khuado Kut - It is a thanksgiving ceremony observed on a full moon nights after the harvest.

question: ‘Attolu Eidu' is the cultural festival of which of the following union territories? SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Lakshadweep. Attolu Eidu festival was conducted across Lakshadweep Island, at locations such as Minicoy, Kalpeni, Amini, Kiltanam and Kavaratt.

question: Which of the following folk dances is conducted during the Bwisagu Festival? SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Bagurumba. Bwisagu is the springtime festival of the Bodo community that marks the beginning of the New Year in the month of Baisakh (mid-April). The Bagurumba dance or 'Butterfly Dance,' is performed by Bodo women. The Bagurumba dance is a celebration of life, nature, and the vibrant culture of the Bodo tribe. Bhortal Nritya (Assam) - Performed by Barpeta tribe , Jhumur dance (Assam) - Performed by the Kulis (tea tribe).

question: Lathmar Holi is primarily celebrated in the state of: SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. Lathmar Holi is celebrated in the twin towns of Barsana and Nandgaon, also known as the towns of Radha and Krishna respectively. Famous festivals of Uttar Pradesh - Gaurav Mahotsav, Ramotsav, Taj Mahotsav, Ayodhya Deepotsav, Ganga Mahotsav. Arunachal Pradesh - Sangken, Mopin, Pongtu. Himachal Pradesh - Halda, Doongri, Chet Festival, Kullu Dussehra. Karnataka - Ugadi, Mysuru Dasara, Kambala, Gowri Habba.

question: Which of the following celebrations is dedicated to Sun God and his wife Usha to thank them for sustaining life on earth and for granting wishes? SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Chhath Puja (main festival of Bihar) is a four-day long strict and spiritual observance. The first day of the Chhath Puja includes taking a dip in the holy river/any water body. The second day of Chhath, also known as Kharna, involves devotees observing a day-long fast. The third day of Chhath goes in the preparation of the prasad (offerings) for the evening offerings, also known as Sanjhiya Arghya. On the fourth and final day of Chhath, family members and friends go to the banks of rivers before sunrise and make offerings (Arghya) to the rising sun.

question: ‘Nuakhai’ is the state festival of: SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Odisha. Nuakhai is an annual harvest, marking the arrival of the new rice season. It is observed on Panchami Tithi (fifth day) of the lunar fortnight of Bhadrava (August-September), the day after Ganesh Chaturthi. Other festivals: Odisha - Ratha Yatra, Raja Parba, Chandan Yatra, Bali Jatra.

question: Which of the following festivals is celebrated as the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Gurpurab. Guru Nanak Jayanti, also known as Gurpurab, celebrates the birth anniversary of the first Sikh Guru, Guru Nanak Dev. This festival occurs on Kartik Poornima, the fifteenth lunar day of the month of Kartik, typically in November on the Gregorian calendar. Hola Mohalla, or Hola, is a three-day Sikh festival that usually takes place in March. Vaisakhi, celebrated on April 13 or sometimes April 14, marks the first day of the month of Vaisakh. Chhapar Mela, a popular Punjabi fair, occurs annually in September in the village of Chhapar in the Ludhiana district of Punjab.

question: Harela is a festival of greenery, peace, prosperity, and environmental conservation, primarily celebrated in which of the following states ? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Uttarakhand. Harela, meaning "Day of Green," marks the new harvest brought by the rainy season and is celebrated annually during the Shravan month in the Kumaon region. Important Indian Festivals - Uttarakhand : Phool Dei, Olgia/Ghee Sankranti, Bat Savitri, Ganga Dussehra/Dasar, Nanda Devi Rajjaat. Assam : Ambubachi festival, Bihu, Majuli festival. Madhya Pradesh : Khajuraho festival, Lokrang Festival, Bhagoria Haat Festival.

question: ‘Sangken’ is a festival celebrated in Arunachal Pradesh by people of which of the following religions? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Buddhism. Sangken (festival of water) is an annual three-day long festival. The Khampti and Singpho tribes of the Lohit district in Arunachal Pradesh celebrate it. It is celebrated by the Theravada Buddhist Communities. It is celebrated as Songkran in other Southeast Asian countries. Songkran is the Thai New Year’s national holiday. More Buddhists festivals include Buddha Purnima, Hemis Festival, Losar Festival, Lumbini Festival, Parinirvana Day, Rumtek Chaam Festival and Mani Rimdu Festival.

question: Shab-e-Barat is celebrated by which religious group? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Muslim. Shab-e-Barat, also known as Mid-Sha'ban, is observed on the 15th night of Sha'ban in the Islamic calendar. Festivals celebrated by : Muslim - Eid al-Fitr, Eid al-Adha etc; Buddhist - Buddha Purnima, Vesak etc; Jain - Mahavir Jayanti, Paryushana etc; Parsi - Navroz, Jamshedi Navroz etc.

question: In which state/UT is the Hemis festival celebrated? www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Ladakh. Festivals in India: Ladakh: Sindhu Darshan Festival, Losar Festival, Tak-Thok, Matho Nagrang.

question: Thrissur Pooram is one of the famous temple festivals celebrated in _______. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Kerala. Thrissur Pooram is celebrated in the Malayalam month of Medam (April-May). Other festivals: Kerala - Onam, Vishu, Attukal Pongala.

question: The festival of ‘Rath Yatra’ of Puri in Odisha is dedicated to which deity? SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Lord Jagannath. Rath Yatra Festival : Celebrated on the second day of the bright fortnight in the month of Ashadha, this festival features a public procession with three large chariots carrying the deities Jagannath, Balabhadra, Subhadra.

question: Which of the following festivals is celebrated in Madhya Pradesh? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Khajuraho Dance Festival - Organized by the Kala Parishad of the Madhya Pradesh government. It is a seven-day long festival which usually takes place from the 20th of February to the 26th of February. It is held at Khajuraho temples. It was started in 1975. Some festivals which have been organized in Madhya Pradesh are Jal Mahotsav, Mandu Mahotsav, Orchha Mahotsav, Satpura Cycle Safari, Heritage Run.

question: Kajari Mahotsav is primarily celebrated in which of the following districts of Uttar Pradesh? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Mirzapur. The festival is celebrated in honor of King Kantit Naresh's daughter, Kajali, renowned for her melodious love songs. Other major festivals in Uttar Pradesh include Ganga Mahotsav in Varanasi and Taj Mahotsav in Agra.

question: The chariot festival is dedicated to Lord Jagannath along with Subhadra and _________ . SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Balabhadra. Lord Jagannath, his brother Balabhadra, and his sister Subhadra are a trio of deities worshiped at the Jagannath temple (Puri, Odisha). It is one of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites. The temple was built on the basis of Kalinga architecture.

question: Navratri festival is dedicated to which of the following Goddesses? SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Durga. Navratri, meaning ‘nine nights’ in Sanskrit, is a festival where people fast and pray to the nine forms of Goddess Durga, an incarnation of Parvati, who defeated Mahishasura. The two popular folk dances of Gujarat, the Garba and Dandia are performed by both men and women during this occasion on every night.

question: In which of the following states is Me - dam - me - phi festival primarily celebrated? SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Assam. Me-Dam-Me-Phi is a community festival celebrated by the Ahom people in memory of their dearly departed. ‘Me’ means offering, ‘Dam’ means ancestors and ‘Phi’ means god. The major festivals celebrated in Assam are Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Bohaggiyo Bishu, and Ambubashi Mela.

question: ‘Atla Taddi’ is the widely celebrated festival of which Indian state? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Andhra Pradesh. Atla Taddi, a traditional Hindu festival where women pray to Goddess Gauri for marital blessings. It occurs on the third night after the full moon in the Aswiyuja month, usually in September or October. Other festivals of Andhra Pradesh: Ugadi, Ratha Saptami, Tirupati Ganga Jatara, Pyditthallamma utsavam, Rottela Panduga (Rotiyaan ki Eid), Visakha Utsav, Lumbini festival.

question: Kati Bihu is celebrated in which of the following months in Assam? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: October. Kati Bihu is one of the three Bihu festivals celebrated in Assam. Kati means to cut and this day marks the time of relocation of rice saplings. It is also known as Kongali Bihu. There are another two Bihu festivals celebrated in Assam - Bhogali (Magh Bihu) is observed in January and Rongali (Bohag Bihu) is observed in April. Other festivals of Assam: Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Ambubashi Mela and Jonbill Mela.

question: Which of the following is a festival primarily celebrated in the state of Odisha? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Raja Parba. It is a unique festival celebrating the onset of the monsoon and the earth’s womanhood. It is held for three days in the month of June. Odisha's famous festivals include Konark Dance Festival, Kalinga Mahotsava, Durga Puja, Chhau Festival, Puri Beach Festival, Nuakhai, Pakhala Dibasa, and Laxmi Puja.

question: By what name is the festival of Makar Sankranti celebrated in Assam? SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Magh Bihu. Makar Sankranti is celebrated in January and marks the transition of the sun into the zodiac sign

question: Which of the following festivals observed in Assam is majorly celebrated by Vaishnavites? SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Doljatra (Dol Purnima) is a Hindu festival that celebrates the love between Radha and Krishna, observed on the full moon day of the Falgun month. Bihu consists of three festivals - Rongali, Kongali, and Bhogali - celebrated by all Assamese people, regardless of religion. Ambubachi Mela is held at the Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati, dedicated to Goddess Kamakhya, a Shakti deity.

question: Makar Sankranti is the festival dedicated to which of the following Lords? SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Surya. Makar Sankranti signifies the entry of the Sun into the zodiac sign of Makara or Capricorn. Festivals related to Lord Surya: Ratha Saptami, Chhath, Pongal, Mitrotsavam. The festival dedicated to Lord Ganesha is Ganesh Chaturthi. Indra Jatra is a festival in Sikkim that celebrates Lord Indra. The festivals related to the moon are Eid, Guru Purnima, Karwachauth.

question: Bihu festival is the main festival of which state? SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Assam. Bihu occurs three times a year: Bhogali Bihu (January) marks the harvest's end, Rongali Bihu (April) celebrates the Assamese New Year and the harvest's start, and Kangali Bihu (October) involves lighting lamps by a Tulsi plant during the lean season.

question: Hola Mohalla is a festival associated with which religion/belief? SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Sikhism. Hola Mohalla : This festival is a vibrant three-day Sikh festival celebrated in spring on the second day of the lunar month of Chett, the first month of the Nanakshahi calendar. The main procession occurs at Takht Sri Keshgarh Sahib in Anandpur, Punjab, a site of historical significance as the birthplace of the Khalsa Panth in 1699, where Guru Gobind Singh founded the Khalsa Panth. Other Sikh festivals: Baisakhi, Maghi, Bandi Chhor Divas, Guru Nanak Jayanti.

question: The ‘Lokranjan’ festival celebrates the folk and tribal culture of which Indian state? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. Lokranjan is a vibrant tribal dance festival held annually in Khajuraho, Madhya Pradesh, organized by the Adivasi Lok Kala Academy in association with the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation. Celebrated from 8th to 12th December. Some popular folk dances of Madhya Pradesh include Jawara, Matki, Aada, Khada Nach, Phulpati, Grida Dance, Selalarki, Selabhadoni, and Maanch.

question: Rottela Panduga or the Roti Festival is celebrated in which Indian state? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Andhra Pradesh. Rotiyaan Ki Eid, or Rottela Panduga, is an annual three-day festival held at Bara Shaheed Dargah in Nellore, Andhra Pradesh. This event is observed in Muharram to commemorate the urs (death anniversary) of the 12 martyrs buried in the shrine. Women visiting the shrine exchange rotis at Nellore Tank. Other notable festivals celebrated in Andhra Pradesh include Pongal, Ugadi, Sri Rama Navami, Ratha Saptami, Tirupati Ganga Jatara, and Visakha Utsav.

question: Vishu festival is celebrated in which of the following states? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Kerala And Tamil Nadu. Vishu is a Hindu festival celebrated on the first day of the Malayali month of Medam (Malayalam New Year). New year festivals : Ugadi (Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Telangana), Gudi Padwa (Maharashtra), Baisakhi (Punjab, Haryana), Pohela Boishakh (West Bengal, Tripura), Puthandu (Tamil Nadu), Bohag Bihu (Assam), Cheti Chand (Sindhi community), Losoong (Sikkim), Navreh (Kashmir), Chaitra Sukladi (North India).

question: Sakewa is a religious festival celebrated by the Kirat Khambu Rai community of SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Sikkim. 'Sakewa' is an annual festival and is celebrated as a tribute to mother nature. The rituals for this particular festival are performed in an open space, which is also known as Bhoomi Puja or Chandi Puja. Other important festivals of Sikkim: Losung, Drupka Tesh, Bumchu, Saga Dawa, Dasin and Phang Lhabsol .

question: ‘Hampi Utsava,’ which is celebrated in Karnataka, is also called ____________. The festival that captures the pomp, splendour and glory of the historical period of Karnataka is celebrated over a week. SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Vijaya Utsava celebrates the grandeur of the Vijayanagara Empire and is held over a week in Karnataka. Festivals of Karnataka: Vairamudi Festival, Kambala Festival, Karaga Festival, Ugadi. The Sarhul festival marks the beginning of the New Year and is celebrated by the Oraon, Munda, and Ho tribes of Jharkhand.

question: The Indian festival of Holi comes every year in the season of: SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Spring. Holi, also known as the Festival of Colors, is celebrated on the full moon day of the Phalguna month

question: Mewar festival is celebrated during the _______ festival at Udaipur. SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Gangaur - A festival devoted to Goddess Parvati. It is celebrated in March. Festivals of Rajasthan : Camel Festival (Bikaner), Kumbhalgarh Festival, Desert Festival (Jaisalmer), Kajli Teej (Bundi), Abhaneri (Dausa), Ranakpur (Pali), Matsya Festival (Alwar) and Bundi Festival (Bundi).

question: In which country is the ‘Kachin Manaw Festival’ celebrated ? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Myanmar. In the Kachin Manaw Festival, the Kachins perform the Manaw dance - a dance that was part of the Nat (spirit worship) many years ago. Famous festivals of Myanmar : Thingyan, Ananda Pagoda Festival, Kyaukse elephant dance festival.

question: _________ is a significant festival of the Parsi people who practice Zoroastrianism as it marks the birth anniversary of Zoroaster. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Khordad Sal. The Gahambars were established as a means of celebrating the six primordial elements of creation: sky, water, earth, plants, animals, and humans. Papeti (Navroz or Parsi New Year) is a festival celebrated by the Parsi community. It marks the start of the Iranian calendar and is an auspicious occasion for the Zoroastrian community.

question: Which of the following is the festival of Kerala that heralds the harvest season, lasts for 10 days, and has snake boat races etc? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Onam. Onam is the biggest festival in the Indian state of Kerala. Onam Festival falls during the Malayali month of Chingam (Aug - Sep) and marks the homecoming of legendary King Mahabali. Kumarakom boat race is the most admired boat race to take place on the Vembanad Lake in September during Onam. Other Festivals of Kerala : Thrissur Pooram Festival, Attukal Pongala Festival, Navarathri Festival, Makaravilakku Festival, Kerala Village Fair, Aluva Sivarathri Festival, Vishu Festival.

question: Muharram is the _______ month of the Islamic Calendar and is considered a holy month. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: first. Muharram : It is a sacred festival that commemorates the martyrdom of Hazrat Imam Hussein. During this occasion, a relic called Alam is taken out as a procession. This festival is known as Peerla Panduga in Telangana. Other festivals of Muslims : Id-ul-Zuha, Shab-e-Barat, Milad-un-Nabi, Ramadan, Eid al-Adha.

question: Bali Yatra, is a traditional cultural festival of which state ? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Odisha. Bali Jatra is the major Boita Bandana festival held at Cuttack on Kartik Purnima and lasts for 7 days or more. It is considered to be one of Asia's largest open trade fair. Other Festivals of Odisha: Kalipuja, Dola Purnima (Holi), Chandan Yatra, Snana Yatra, Ratha Yatra, Kalinga Mahotsav, Konark Dance Festival, Ekamra Utsav, etc.

question: Jamshedi Navroz is a festival of _________ community. SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Parsi. Navroz has links with the legend of King Jamshid of Iran, also called Jamshedi Navroz. It is celebrated on the first day of the first month of the Fasli calendar, which usually falls on August 18 or August 19.

question: Dussehra festival is celebrated in which of the following Hindu months ? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Ashwin. Other Hindu festivals according to the Hindu calendar : Holi is celebrated in the Phalguna month (February - March). Makar Sankranti is celebrated in the month of Magh (January). Raksha Bandhan is celebrated on the full moon day (Purnima) of the Shravana month (July - August). Deepawali is celebrated every year on the 15th lunar day of the Kartik month (October - November).

question: The Braj festival in ________ is held every year for two days in the Shukla Paksha of the Phalgun month, a few days before Holi. SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Rajasthan. Braj festival is dedicated to Lord Krishna who is believed to have spent a considerable amount of time in this region. Other festivals of the state with districts: Kajli Teej - Bundi, Abhaneri festival’ - Dausa, Marwar Festival - Jodhpur. Momasar - Bikaner, Chandrabhaga - Jhalawar, Matsya - Alwar, Kolayat - Bikaner, Kumbhalgarh fort festival - Udaipur, Ranakpur pali.

question: Pinjore heritage festival is organised by the state of ________. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Haryana. The Pinjore Heritage Festival is held annually in December at the historic Yadavindra Gardens in Pinjore, Panchkula, Haryana. This event is organized to celebrate and honor the unique heritage of Pinjore and its renowned Mughal Gardens. The festival was first introduced in 2006.

question: In Gujarat, the festival Makar Sankranti is celebrated as: SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Uttarayan. Makar Sankranti denotes the entry of the sun into the zodiac sign of Makara (Capricorn) as it travels on its celestial path. As part of the official celebration of 'Uttarayan', the Gujarat government has been hosting the International Kite Festival since 1989.

question: The Kutch festival is held at _____. SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Bhuj. It is a carnival of music, dance, and natural beauty in White Rann. Other important festivals of Gujarat: International Kite Festival (known as Makar Sankranti or Uttarayan) - Celebrates Makar Sankranti or Uttarayan in Ahmedabad. Tarnetar fair - Based on the legend of Draupadi's swayamvara. Megh Malhar Parv -an annual celebration that takes place in the Saputara region every monsoon. Navratri - : Festival celebrating feminine divinity, Shakti.

question: Easter is a religious festival of: SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Christians. Easter celebrates the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.It is observed on the first Sunday following the full Moon after the spring equinox. The custom of decorating eggs is practiced during Easter. The holiday concludes the “Passion of Christ,” a series of events and holidays that begins with Lent (a 40-day period of fasting, prayer and sacrifice) and ends with Holy Week, which includes Holy Thursday, Good Friday, and Easter Sunday.

question: 'Tamu Lochar' is one of the traditional festivals of the_________of Sikkim. It is celebrated to mark the beginning of their new year, which falls on the 15th day of Pusa, according to the Hindu calendar Vikram Samvat and 30th December in the English calendar. SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Gurung community. Festivals celebrated in Sikkim: Maghe Sankranti, Sonam Lochar, Losar, Ramnawami (Chaite Dasain), Sakewa, Saga Dawa, Eid Ul Fitr, Bhanu Jayanti, Drukpa Tshechi, Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Indrajatra, Pang Lhabsol, Barahimizong, Kagyed Dance. Vikram Samvat was started in 57 B.C. when the emperor Vikramaditya defeated Sakas.

question: International Kite Festival is a popular cultural festival of which state? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Gujarat. The International Kite Festival marks the days in the Hindu calendar when winter begins turning to summer, known as Makar Sankranti or Uttarayan. Other Festivals of Gujarat: Rann Utsav, Dang Darbar, Modhera Dance Festival, Madhavrai Festival, and Bhadra Purnima Fair.

question: With reference to Chethiagiri Vihar festival consider the following statements and select the correct option. i) It is a Buddhist festival. ii) It is held at Sanchi, Madhya Pradesh. iii) Relics of SariPutta and Maha Moggallana are worshiped SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: i, ii, iii. Other Buddhist festivals include Buddha Purnima, Hemis Festival, Losar Festival, Lumbini Festival, Parinirvana Day, Rumtek Chaam Festival and Mani Rimdu Festival.

question: Every year in the month of February, this camel festival is organised by Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation in __________. SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Bikaner. Bikaner Camel Festival happens in January month which Bikaner celebrates in honor of the 'Ship of the Desert', the Camel. Festivals of Rajasthan: Desert Festival, Pushkar Fair, Jaipur Literature Festival, Nagaur Fair, Kite Festival, Mewar Festival, Urs Festival, Brij Holi, Elephant Festival, Chandrabhaga Fair, Bundi Utsav, Kumbhalgarh festival, Baneshwar festival, Kolayat Fair, etc.

question: According to Hindu calendar, Diwali falls in which of the following months? SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Kartika. Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights. Diwali marks the day when lord Ram returned to Ayodhya after 14 years of exile after defeating King Ravan. The months of the Hindu calendar in order are : Chaitra, Vaisakha, Jyaistha, Asadha, Shravana, Bhadra, Asvina, Kartika, Agrahayana, Pausa, Magha, and Phalguna.

question: Goga Navami, which is primarily celebrated in the Indian state of_______is dedicated to the snake God, Gogaji. SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Rajasthan. Other festivals of state: Gangaur Festival (Jaipur), Desert Festival (Jaisalmer), Summer Festival (Mount Abu), Pushkar Fair (Pushkar), Mewar Festival (Udaipur). Andhra Pradesh - Ratha Saptami, Ugadi. Odisha - Ratha Yatra, Bali Jatra. Karnataka - Pattadakal, Ugadi.

question: Which festival is celebrated after the month of Ramzan ? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st shift)

options.C: Milad un Nabi (d) Jammat Ul Vida

solution.explanation: Eid ul Fitr. It is a religious festival celebrated by Muslims at the end of the holy month of Ramzan. It is celebrated on the first day of Shawwal, the tenth month of the Islamic calendar. Everyone celebrates this festival together and prays to God for happiness, peace, and prosperity.

question: Kojagiri Poornima is a festival celebrated primarily in _______ on the full moon day of Ashwin month. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Maharashtra. Sharad Purnima is also known as Kojagiri or Raas Purnima. It is a harvest festival. Other festivals of Maharashtra : Gudi Padwa or Chaitra Pratipada, Pola, Narali Purnima, Ratha Saptami, Marabats and Badgyas, etc,.

question: Which festival is celebrated by Christians as the birth of Jesus Christ? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Christmas : It is observed on December 25. It corresponds to the traditional date of the winter solstice on the Roman calendar. Good Friday is a Christian holiday commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus and his death at Calvary. It is observed during Holy week as part of the Paschal Triduum. Easter (Pascha) celebrates the Resurrection of Jesus Christ on the third day after his Crucifixion. Eid ul-Fitr is a Muslim festival ending Ramadan, observed with prayers, feasts, and charity.

question: Ugadi is celebrated primarily in which of the following states on the first day of the Chaitra month of the Hindu calendar? SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Karnataka. Ugadi festival represents the beginning of the New Year. Other festivals of Karnataka - Hampi Festival, Karnataka Rajyotsava, Vairamundi Festival. Other states and their festivals : Odisha - Ratha Yatra, Raja Parba, Bali Jatra. Assam - Ambubachi Mela, Dehing Patkai, Bihu. Uttarakhand - Uttarayani, Phool Dei.

question: Which festival is celebrated as the birth of Lord Krishna? SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Janmashtami. It falls on the 8th day of the dark half of the month of Bhadrapada. The activity of making a human pyramid and putting efforts to break an earthen pot filled with buttermilk is associated with this festival.

question: Which of the following states is associated with the Bonalu festival? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Telangana. Bonalu is a traditional Hindu festival, dedicated to Goddess Mahankali, and its name "Bonalu" derives from the Telugu word "Bona" meaning "food" or "offering." It is celebrated in Ashada month (June-July). Other states and their festivals : Tamil Nadu - Pongal, Thaipusam, Natyanjali Festival. Karnataka - Mysore Dasara, Ugadi. Kerala - Onam, Vishu.

question: The festival of Eid Milad-un-Nabi is celebrated in which of the following Islamic months? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Rabi' al-Awwal. Milad un-Nabi (Barawafat), also known as Nabi Day, Mawlid, is a gazetted holiday in India. This festival celebrates the birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammad and is observed by Muslims worldwide. Prophet Muhammad, an Arab religious and political leader, was born in Mecca and is regarded as the founder of Islam.

question: The festival of Ram Navami is celebrated in which of the following Hindu months? Matriculation Level 21/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Chaitra. Ram Navami is celebrated on the ninth day of Chaitra Navaratri, usually in April, marking the birth of Lord Rama, the seventh incarnation of Lord Vishnu, born to King Dasaratha and Queen Kaushalya of Ayodhya. Other important festivals: Holi in Falgun, Diwali in Kartik, and Rakshabandhan in Sravana.

question: According to Hindu calendar, on which day does Holika Dahan take place? Matriculation Level 21/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Phalgun Poornima. Holika Dahan is celebrated on the eve of Holi, the festival of colors. According to the Hindu calendar, Holi takes place on the full moon day (Poornima) of the month of Phalgun. Different names in the different regions - Rang Panchami (Maharashtra, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh), Lathmar Holi (Uttar Pradesh), Holla Mohalla (Punjab), Shigmo (Goa), Royal Holi (Udaipur), Kumaoni Holi and Khadi Holi (Uttarakhand), Manjal Kuli (Kerala), Dol Jatra (West Bengal), Yaosang (Manipur), Phaguwa (Bihar).

question: In which of the following states is the Behdienkhlam festival celebrated in the month of July ? Matriculation Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Meghalaya. Behdienkhlam (chasing away the Demon of Cholera) is celebrated annually in July after the sowing period, the most important dance festival of the Jaintia tribes. Other famous Festivals : Meghalaya - Wangala, Nongkrem, Shad Suk Mynsiem, Shad Sukra. Haryana - Guga Navmi, Gita Jayanti. West Bengal - Shiber Gajan, Disum sendra, Rohini Utsav. Bihar - Chhath Puja, Bihula, Karama.

question: Which of the following holy days in Christianity is a mourning day ? Matriculation Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Good Friday is a solemn holy day in Christianity, observed to commemorate the crucifixion and death of Jesus Christ. It is traditionally a day of mourning, reflection, and fasting. Christmas celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ, while Easter commemorates his resurrection. Maundy Thursday honors the Last Supper of Jesus Christ with his disciples.

question: The Myoko festival is celebrated in which of the following North-Eastern states of India? Matriculation Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Arunachal Pradesh. The Myoko Festival is a month-long traditional celebration of the Apatani tribe. It's one of their most important festivals, aimed at strengthening family and clan bonds, as well as ensuring fertility in both fields and people. Other festivals of Arunachal Pradesh : The Mopin Festival, Losar Festival, Dree Festival of the Apatani, Chalo-Loku of the Nocte, Solung of the Adis, Ziro Festival of Music, Pangsau Pass Winter Festival, and Siang River Festival.

question: The Karbi tribe, which celebrates the cultural festival ‘Rongker’, belongs to the Indian state of _________. Higher Secondary 20/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Assam. Rongker, winter post-harvest festival, is celebrated either on 5th January or 5th February as per the convenience of the villagers. Festival and their tribes : Kherai Puja of the Bodos; the Baikhu and Pharkantis of the Rabhas; the Ali-ai-ligang and Parag of the Mishing tribe; and the Sagra-misawa, wansawa, and laghun of the Tiwas.

question: In which of the following cities is the Agera festival celebrated ? Higher Secondary 21/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Mumbai. Agera is celebrated by the Christian farming community, and it takes place in October. It is a harvest festival. Other cities and their festivals : Kolkata - Durga Puja, Mumbai - Ganesh Chaturthi, Chennai - Pongal.

question: In which of the following states of India is the Chethiyagiri Vihara festival celebrated ? Higher Secondary 24/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. The Chethiyagiri Vihara Festival, celebrated in November, attracts hundreds of pilgrims to Sanchi in the Raisen District to view the relics of Buddha’s two great disciples, Sariputta and Mahamogallena. Other festivals of Madhya Pradesh: Lokrang, Akhil Bhartiya Kalidas Samaroh,

question: Which of the following festivals is also known as the ‘100 drums festival’? Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Wangala. This festival is celebrated after harvest to thank Misi Saljong, the ‘Sun God’ and Mini-ma Kiri Rokime, the ‘Goddess of Grains’. This festival is usually celebrated in the month of October or November. Festivals of Meghalaya: Shad Suk Mynsiem, Nongkrem Festival, Behdienkhlam Festival, Shad Sukra, Strawberry Festival.

question: In which of the following festivals is Kolam drawn? Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Pongal. It is a harvest festival celebrated by the Tamil community. It is primarily celebrated in Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Puducherry. Other harvesting festivals: Karma (Jharkhand), Bhogali Bihu (Assam), Hareli (Chhattisgarh), Onam (Kerala), Nuakhai (Odisha), Gudi Padwa (Maharashtra).

question: 'Moatsu' is a religious festival celebrated in which of the following states? Graduate Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Nagaland. The Moatsu Festival is celebrated by the Ao tribes of Nagaland during the first week of May every year for three days. Other festivals celebrated in Nagaland: Nazu Festival, Amongmong Festival, and Hornbill Festival. States and their festivals: Chhattisgarh - Bastar Dussehra, Madai Festival, Hareli Festival, and Kajari Festival. Himachal Pradesh - Losar, Doongri, and Halda. Mizoram - Khuado Kut, Mim Kut, and Chapchar Kut.

question: ‘Gugga Naumi’ – the festival celebrated in Haryana and some parts of Punjab, Rajasthan, UP and Himachal Pradesh______is known as the festival of: SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Snake-worshiping. Gugga Naumi festival celebrated in the honour of Gugga Pir. It is observed on the 9th day of the Krishna Paksha (waning phase of moon) in Bhadon month (August and September).

question: Doul Utsav is majorly celebrated in which of the following states ? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Assam. Doul Utsav is also called ‘holi’ or ‘rang. Other festivals celebrated in Assam - Bihu, Baishagu, Ali-Ai-Ligang, Baikho, Rongker, Rajini Gabra, Harni Gabra, Bohaggiyo Bishu, Ambubachi Mela and Jonbill Mela. Festivals in other states: Bihar - Chhath Puja, Bihula, Sama chakeva. Chhattisgarh - Pola, Madai Festival, Hareli, Bhoramdeo Mahotsav. Maharashtra - Ganesh Utsav, Gudi Padva.

question: Bhagoria is a festival associated with which of the following festivals ? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Holi: A Hindu festival that is celebrated in the spring season. Bhagoria is a tribal festival that is celebrated in Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra. question: Who among the following was a poet who won the Nobel Prize for literature in 1913 ? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Rabindranath Tagore. He was also referred to as ‘Gurudev’, ‘Kabiguru’, and ‘Biswakabi’. He got Nobel Prize for his work Gitanjali. He was a Bengali poet, novelist, and painter, who was highly influential in introducing Indian culture to the west. He was the first non-European to receive the Nobel Prize.

question: Which Indian political leader was called as Lok Nayak? SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

Famous Personalities & their Nicknames: Bihar Kesri - Sri Krishna Sinha, Bihar Vibhuti - Dr. Anurag Narayan Singh, Iron Man of India - Vallabhai Patel, Biswa Kavi - Rabindranath Tagore, Netaji - Subhash Chandra Bose. Lokmanya Tilak - Bal Gangadhar Tilak.

question: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, who was the first Home Minister of India, is known by which sobriquet? SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Iron man of India. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel is popularly known as the "Iron Man of India" due to his crucial role in the unification and integration of Indian princely states such as Travancore, Hyderabad, Junagadh, Bhopal into the Indian Union. Other sobriquet personalities: Father of Indian Unrest - Bal Gangadhar Tilak, Grand old man of India - Dadabhai Naoroji, Morning star of Indian Renaissance - Raja Ram Mohan Roy.

question: Which of the following is an autobiography of a Bengali illiterate woman who secretly acquired literacy skills to read sacred texts in an age when girls and women were denied education and deemed fit only for household chores ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.correct_answer: B. Amar Jiban by Rassundari Devi
solution.explanation: Amar Jiban by Rassundari Devi. She was the first Indian woman to write an autobiography and the first Bengali to write an autobiography. Authors and Books: Baby Kamble - ‘’The Prisons We Broke’’. Lakshmibai Tilak - ‘’Smritichitre’’. Kamala Suraiyya - ‘’The Old Playhouse And Other Poems’’, ‘’Padmavati the Harlot and Other Stories’’.

question: Who became the first Vice-Chancellor of Jawaharlal Nehru University in 1969 ? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: G Parthasarathi. Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU): A public major research university located in New Delhi, India. It was established in 1969 and named after Jawaharlal Nehru, India's first Prime Minister. Other Central Universities : Aligarh Muslim University (1875), Assam University, Banaras Hindu University (1916), Central University of Gujarat (2009).

question: Who was the first woman graduate of Calcutta University ? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Kadambini Ganguly and Chandramukhi Basu were the first BA graduates in the British empire in India. She was the South Asia's first female surgeon. Rajkumari Amritkaur - The first Health Minister of India (1947).

question: Who among the following advocated the ideology of "oru jati, oru matam, oru daivam manushyanu" (one caste, one religion, one god for humankind)? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Narayana Guru. He belongs to Ezhava caste and was considered ‘avarna’. He built a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva at Aruvippuram which was against the caste based restrictions of the time. He established the Sree Narayana Dharma Paripalana Yogam (SNDP), a charitable society. His Books: “Advaitha Deepika”, “Asrama”and “Thevarappathinkangal”. He became the proponent of Advaita Vedanta (Principle of non-duality) put forward by Adi Shankara.

question: Which of the following persons has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize ? SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Kailash Satyarthi was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014 "for the struggle against the suppression of children and young people and the right of all children to education". He founded the Bachpan Bachao Andolan (Save the Childhood Movement) in 1980.

question: In 2019, a minor planet between Mars and Jupiter was named after whom among the following Indian musicians by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) ? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Pt Jasraj. The International Astronomical Union (IAU) has named minor planet 2006 VP32 (number - 300128), discovered on November 11, 2006, as 'Pandit Jasraj'. He became the first Indian musician to get honored with this unique recognition.

question: On which of the following dates does India celebrate its Constitution Day? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 26th November. The Constitution of India was adopted on 26 November 1949, that is why Constitution Day is celebrated on 26 November. 15th August : Independence Day (commemorating India’s independence from British rule in 1947). 2nd October : Gandhi Jayanti (the birthday of Mahatma Gandhi, celebrated as a national holiday and also observed as International Day of Non-Violence). 26th January : Republic Day (the Constitution of India came into force on 26 January 1950).

question: The birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi is celebrated as the national festival of India. In which of the following years was Gandhi ji born ? SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 1869. 2nd October is also observed globally as the International Day of Non-Violence in recognition of his contributions to peace and non-violent movements. India's three national festivals are: Republic Day (January 26) - Marks the adoption of the Indian Constitution in 1950. Independence Day (August 15) - Commemorates India's independence from British rule in 1947. Gandhi Jayanti (October 2) - Celebrates the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi.

question: In India, Teachers’ Day is celebrated annually on September 5 to mark the birthday of: SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan. He served as India's first Vice-President from 1952 to 1962. He was awarded the Bharat Ratna in 1954. APJ Abdul Kalam : He was an Indian aerospace scientist and the 11th President of India. His birthday on October 15 is celebrated as World Students' Day to honor his dedication to education. Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel : His birthday (October 31) is celebrated as National Unity Day or Rashtriya Ekta Diwas in India. Subhas Chandra Bose : His birthday (January 23) is celebrated as Parakram Diwas in India.

question: In November 2021, the government declared November 15 as ‘Janjatiya Gaurav Divas’. It happens to be the birth anniversary of which of the following freedom fighters? SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Birsa Munda. Janjatiya Gaurav Divas celebrations begin with President Murmu paying tribute to Bhagwan Birsa Munda in Khunti district, Jharkhand. Birsa Munda (1875-1900) was born into a Munda family, a tribal group residing in Chotanagpur. He led the Munda Rebellion, a significant tribal uprising in the region south of Ranchi, between 1899 and 1900.

question: When is National Javelin Day celebrated in India ? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (4th shift)

Other Important Days: 12th January: National Youth Day (Swami Vivekananda's birthday), 29th August: National Sports Day (birth anniversary of Major Dhyan Chand).

solution.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Rooftop rainwater harvesting is a technique used for the conservation of water. question: What is the function of the CPU after the DMA transfer starts? SSC CHSL Tier II 18/11/2024

question: Which of the following best describes the primary difference between broadband and dial-up Internet connections? SSC CHSL Tier II 18/11/2024

solution.explanation: N-1. Network topology - Arrangement of a network, comprising nodes and connecting lines. There are 6 types of topology, Bus Topology - Every computer is connected to a common bus (single cable), Ring Topology - Every node is connected to two other nodes, forming a loop. Tree Topology - A central root node from which all other nodes branch out, Star Topology - Each device on the network is connected to a central hub, Mesh Topology ({n(n-1)/2})- Each node is connected to every other node in the network, Hybrid Topology - It is a combination of two or more network topologies.

question: What does SAARC stand for? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (2nd shift)

question: What is the full form of ‘PM-SYM’? SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (2nd shift)

question: The CPWD along with the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways works for public infrastructure. What is the full form of CPWD? Higher Secondary 26/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) operates under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs of India. It acts as the builder, developer, and manager of Central government properties. Over time, its operations have expanded to include roadways and bridge engineering. Established in 1854, its headquarters is located in the Central Secretariat in New Delhi.

There are 39 eligible activities under RIDF. Eligible activities are classified under three broad categories: Agriculture and related sector, Social sector, Rural connectivity.

question: What is the full form of IADP? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (4th shift)

question: A balanced diet should meet the RDAs for an individual. State the full form of RDA. SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: The Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) is the average daily dietary intake level that is sufficient to meet the nutrient requirement of nearly all (97 to 98 percent) healthy individuals in a particular gender and life stage group.

question: In the context of the banking sector, what does ‘F’ stand for in IFSC? SSC CPO 25/11/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Financial. IFSC stands for Indian Financial system Code. It is an 11 digit alphanumeric code used to uniquely identify bank branches within the National Electronic Funds transfer (NEFT) network by the central bank. Religious Places

question: At which place was the magnificent temple of Saiva constructed by the great Rashtrakuta King ‘Krishna I’? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Ellora. The temples at Ellora Caves (Maharashtra) were built by the Rashtrakuta and Yadava dynasties. Rashtrakuta dynasty built the Hindu and Buddhist caves during their reign. The Kailasa Temple (dedicated to Lord Shiva) was built by Krishna I of the Rashtrakuta dynasty. It is the largest single-rock excavation in the world. Yadava dynasty built many of the Jain caves. The Ellora Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The caves include 12 Buddhist caves, 17 Hindu caves, and 5 Jain caves.

question: Brihadiswara Temple which exhibits Dravidian temple architecture is located in__________. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Thanjavur (Tamil Nadu). Brihadeshwara Temple (also known as Thanjai Periya Kovil and Rajarajeswaram) is a Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva. It was built by Tamil King Raja Raja Chola I. The temple is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site known as the “Great Living Chola Temples”, with the other two being Gangaikonda Cholapuram and Airavatesvara temple.

question: The Sun Temple at Konark was built under the rule of which dynasty? SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Eastern Ganga Dynasty. Konark Sun Temple is a 13th-century CE Sun temple at Konark in Puri district, Odisha. This temple is attributed to King Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty.Temple is a classic illustration of Great Kalinga Architecture. It is dedicated to the God Surya. The famous Chandrabhaga Mela takes place here every year in the month of February. This temple is also called "Black Pagoda". The temple was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1984.

question: Lad Khan Temple at Aihole in Karnataka is an example of which of the following styles of temple architecture? Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Vesara style of temples is a combination of both Nagara (North India) and Dravida (South India), its superstructure is bell-shaped. Examples of Vesara Style temples in Karnataka: Mahadeva temple (Ittagi); Kasivisvesvara temple (Lakkundi); Kallesvara Temple (Kukkanur).

question: The Trimbakeshwar Temple, www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK which is situated in Nashik, Maharashtra, was built by : Graduate Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Balaji Baji Rao. Trimbakeshwar Temple, a renowned religious center, houses one of the twelve Jyotirlingas and is located at the foot of Brahmagiri Hill in the city of Trimbak. Other notable temples and their builders include the Brihadeeswara Temple (Raja Raja Chola I of the Chola dynasty), Konark Sun Temple (King Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga Dynasty), and the Kailasa Temple at Ellora (Krishna I of the Rashtrakuta dynasty).

Hoysaleswara Temple - Karnataka.

question: Where is the Mahabodhi temple situated? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Bodh Gaya (Bihar). First temple was established in the 3rd century BC by Mauryan emperor Ashoka. Famous Temples in Bihar: Vishnupad Mandir and Mangala Gowri Temple (Gaya), Pawapuri Jal Mandir (Nalanda) and Mithila Shakti Peeth (Darbhanga).

question: Bhitargaon Brick temple is a good example of architecture of which of the following periods? SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

Other Gupta period Architectures: Ajanta, Ellora, Sarnath. Temples built during Gupta Period: Dashavatara Temple (Deogarh), Bhitari Temple (Ghazipur).

question: In which of the following countries is the Hindu religious place www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK 'Chandranath Hill' located? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Bangladesh. Chandranath Temple :- It is located on top of the Chandranath Hill, is a famous Shakti Peeth located near Sitakunda in Bangladesh.

question: In North Indian temple architecture , which element denotes the superstructure or tower above the sanctum and the pillared mandapas? Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Shikhara - A tower, in elevation, which is progressively inclined in a convex curve. The three most common temple architecture are: Nagara in the north (between the Himalayas and Vindhyas), and Dravidian in the south. The Vesara style of temples is an admixture of Nagara and Dravidian styles.

question: Which of the following temples is built in the style of the Rekha Deula or the one with a curvilinear superstructure? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Lord Shiva. Ramappa Temple (Rudreshwara Temple or Ramalingeswara Temple) - Situated in Palampet in (Warangal) Telangana. It is a masterpiece of the Kakatiyan style of temple architecture. In July 2021, Ramappa Temple was declared as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Other famous temples (Telangana) - Chilkur Balaji Temple, Sanghi Temple, Gnana Saraswathi Temple, Surendrapuri Temple, Karmanghat Hanuman Temple, Beechupally Anjaneya Swamy Temple.

question: ______ was considered as the most important part of some of the earliest Hindu temples. SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Garbhagriha - Inner chamber of the temple where the main deity was placed. It is also known as Sanctum Sanctorium. Other parts of Hindu Temple : Mandapa - Incorporates space for a large number of worshippers, Shikhar - Mountain-like spire, Vahan - Vehicle of the temple’s main deity, Amalak and Kalash - Crowning elements.

Dedicated to Lord Siva. It is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site (1986). Other Monuments at Hampi - Vittala Temple, Ganigatti Jain temple, Krishna Temple and Lotus Mahal.

question: Lingaraja Temple is situated in which of the following states of India? SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

Tamil Nadu: Murugan Temple at Saluvankuppam, Brihadeeswarar Temple (Thanjavur), Iravatanesvara temple.

question: Which of the following temple is situated in Tamil Nadu ? SSC CHSL 17/03/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: The Shore Temple (Dravidian style). It is located in Mahabalipuram (Tamil Nadu). It was designated a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1984. It was built in the reign of Narasimhavarman II.

question: Which among the following is NOT a component of Lion Capital at Sarnath, India? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Carved cow representing South direction. The top of the column—the capital—has three parts. First, a base of a lotus flower (ubiquitous symbol of Buddhism). Then, a drum on which four animals are carved represents the four cardinal directions: a horse (west), an ox (east), an elephant (south), and a lion (north). Four lions stand at top of the drum, each facing in the four cardinal directions.

question: In the Kandariya Mahadeva Temple, _______ was the place of ritual worship, where only the king, his family members and the priests used to gather. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: sanctum sanctorum. Garbha griha (Temple's innermost part where the Murti of the deity is kept). Temple Other Part - Mahamaṇḍapa (greater hall). Antarala (small antechamber or foyer between garbhagriha and mandapa). Amalaka (notched stone disk, usually with ridges on the rim, that sits on the top temple's shikhara. Kandariya Mahadeva temple (Nagara Style of Architecture) (Madhya Pradesh) was constructed by king Dhaṇgadeva (Chandela dynasty) in 999 CE.

question: In which state of India is the Sri Brahmapureeswarar temple situated? SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Afternoon)

question: What is the stone-like disc seen at the top of the temple in Odisha and nearby district's Temple architecture called? SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: ‘Amalaka’ is one of the important elements of Temple Shikhara (Tower) in Nagara Shaili usually found in Uttara Bharatha. A mandir ‘kalash’ is a metal or stone spire used to top the domes of Hindu temples. In Hindu temple architecture, the ‘jagati' is the raised surface of the platform or terrace upon which some Buddhist or Hindu temples are built.

question: Khajuraho temple in Madhya Pradesh is an example of ___________ style of temple architecture. SSC MTS 13/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Nagara. The Khajuraho Group of Monuments is a group of Hindu temples and Jain temples in Chhatarpur district, Madhya Pradesh, India. They are a UNESCO World Heritage Site (1986).

question: Madan Mohan temple is a centrally protected monument. It is situated in which state of India? SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Morning)

question: Which of the following is correct about Nagara or North Indian Temple Style Architecture? SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)

options.A: There were no tower or shikhara
options.C: There was no Kalasha, the topmost

solution.correct_answer: D. The garbhagriha is always located
solution.explanation: Features of Nagara style temple: It is built on a stone platform with steps leading up to it, It does not usually have elaborate boundary walls or gateways, Amalaka or Kalash which is installed on Shikhara, etc. Sub divisions : Rekha-Prasad or Latina, Shekari, Bhumija, Valabhi , and Phamsana.

question: Harmandir Sahib is situated in which city of Punjab? SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Amritsar, Punjab. Golden Temple (Sri Harmandar Sahib) is the preeminent spiritual site of Sikhism. Some other spiritual sites of Sikhism are the Gurdwara Darbar Sahib Kartarpur in Kartarpur (Pakistan), and Gurdwara Janam Asthan in Nankana Sahib (Pakistan), etc.

question: A 7 meter high sculpture known as 'Sadashiva', representing three aspects of Lord Shiva is found at ______ Caves. SSC MTS 14/10/2021 (Morning)

question: Who established the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON)? SSC MTS 14/10/2021 (Morning)

question: In which of the following states is Sabarimala Sree Dharma Sastha Temple located? SSC CHSL 04/08/2021 (Morning)

question: Identify the correct statement with reference to the Padma awards. SSC MTS 22/10/2024 (1st Shift)

options.A: The Padma award can be used as a
options.B: The total number of Padma awards to
options.D: The names of the awardees are never

solution.correct_answer: C. The Padma Awards are given
solution.explanation: Padma Awards, which were instituted in the year 1954, are announced every year on the occasion of Republic Day. The award is given in 3 categories, namely, Padma Vibhushan for exceptional and distinguished service; Padma Bhushan for distinguished service of a high order; and Padma Shri for distinguished service. The total number of awards to be given in a year (excluding posthumous awards and to NRI/foreigners/OCIs) should not be more than 120. The award does not amount to a title and cannot be used as a suffix or prefix to the awardees’ name.

question: Which television channel presents the IMMIES Awards every year with an aim to reward the best talent in the Indian music industry? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: MTV. The MTV Immies are held every year with an aim to award the best talents in the Indian music industry. question: The Beating Retreat Ceremony during Republic Day is held every year at which of the following places? Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

question: Who takes the salute during the Republic Day parade at New Delhi? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
