question: In which period was the legendary Victoria Terminus Station (currently Chhtarpati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus), Mumbai built? SSC CGL 04/03/2020 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: 1878 to 1883. The Chhatrapati Shivaji station, formerly known as Victoria Terminus, was designed by the British architect F.W. Stevens.

question: In which year was the Currency Building in the BBD Bagh or Dalhousie area of Kolkata constructed? SSC CGL 05/03/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 1833. The beautiful colonial building was designed in Italian style with Venetian windows. This building was the office of the Reserve Bank of India till the year 1937.

question: In which of the following years were two additional Commissioners appointed to the Election commission of India for the first time? SSC CGL 06/03/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 1989. Originally the commission had only a Chief Election Commissioner. It currently consists of the Chief Election Commissioner and two Election Commissioners.

question: Which of the following years is called the Year of the Great Divide in the demographic history of India? SSC CGL 09/03/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 1921 is a “year of the great

question: In 1990, who established Nrityagram, a dance school in Bengaluru? SSC MTS 04/11/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Protima Gauri Bedi. She was an Indian model turned Odissi exponent. Other Odishi Exponents: Kelucharan Mohapatra, Guru Pankaj Charan Das, Sujata Mohapatra, Ratikant Mohapatra, Gangadhar Pradhan, Nandita Behera, Sanchita Bhattacharyaa, Sharmila Biswas.

question: The Lucknow Gharana of Kathak was founded by ___________ , a devotee of the Bhakti movement who lived in southeast Uttar Pradesh. SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Ishwari Prasad. Some Important gharanas and their founders: Kirana gharana - Ustad Abdul Karim Khan. Mewati gharana - Ustad Ghagge Nazir Khan and Ustad Wahid Khan. Indore gharana - Amir Khan. Jaipur-Atrauli gharana - Alladiya Khan.

question: Who among the following was the founding member of Sri Sai Nataraja Academy of Kuchipudi that offers training and higher studies in Kuchipudi? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: P Ramadevi. Natya Tarangini Institute of Kuchipudi Dance : Founded by Raja and Radha Reddy in New Delhi (1976).

question: Who among the following was the founder of the Indian Association for the Cultivation of Science? SSC CGL 18/04/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Mahendra Lal Sircar. Ashutosh Mukhopadhyay founded the Calcutta Mathematical Society in 1908. Prafulla Chandra Roy is known as the father of Indian Chemistry. A crescograph is a device for measuring the growth in plants was invented by Jagadish Chandra Bose.

question: Who among the following made the first compound microscope? SSC MTS 14/10/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Zacharias Jansen. A compound microscope has multiple lenses: The objective lens is compounded (multiplied) by the eyepiece lens to obtain a high magnification.

question: Who among the following Sikh Gurus founded the Tarn Taran Sahib ? SSC CGL 20/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Guru Arjan Dev. He was the fifth Sikh Guru and laid the foundation of Tarn Taran Sahib in 1596.

question: Who among the following invented the aeroplane? SSC CHSL 15/10/2020 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Orville and Wilbur Wright (Wright brothers). Auguste and Louis Lumiere invented cinematograph and autochrome (a photography process). The first practical telephone and Graphophone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell.

question: Which of the following was invented by Walter Hunt? SSC CHSL 21/10/2020 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Safety pin. Walter Hunt also invented a sewing machine in 1833. Safety Lamp invented in 1815 by Sir Humphry Davy.

question: Who among the following founded the Bombay Stock Exchange? SSC CGL 05/03/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Premchand Roychand. Schemes

question: Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar Yojana was implemented through which organisation? SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Employees Provident Fund Organisation. Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar Yojana (ABRY): Launched in 2020 under the Aatmanirbhar Bharat 3.0 package, it aims to boost the economy, generate employment during the post-COVID recovery phase, and incentivize new job creation.

question: During the Green Revolution period in India, child nutrition-focused scheme, the Integrated Child Development Scheme (ICDS) was launched in ________. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 1975. The ICDS scheme provides services to children under 6 years of age, pregnant and lactating mothers, and women aged 16–44. The program's goals are to improve the health, nutrition, and education of the target community.

question: In Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awaas yojana, the cost of unit assistance is shared between Central and State Governments in the ratio ___________ in plain areas. SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 60 : 40. The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G) : Launched on November 20, 2016. It aims to provide housing with basic amenities to houseless families and those living in dilapidated or kutcha houses. Targeting 2.95 crore houses by March 2024. In the Northeastern and Himalayan States, the cost-sharing ratio is 90 : 10. This scheme restructured the Indira Awas Yojana (IAY) from 1985.

question: Which state initiated the implementation of the Mid-day Meal scheme in elementary schools? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Mid-day Meal Scheme : Introduced in 1956 by Tamil Nadu's Chief Minister K. Kamaraj, the scheme aimed to reduce school dropout rates and increase enrollment by providing free meals to students.

question: In which year was the PM Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission launched? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 2021. Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi inaugurated the PM Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission, which aims to be one of the largest initiatives in India focused on improving healthcare infrastructure.

question: Consider the following statements and choose the correct statement(s) from the following: 1. The UDAN scheme has completed five years since its implementation in 2017. 2. It is the flagship scheme of the Ministry of Science and Technology. 3. The Airports Authority of India is the implementing agency of this scheme. SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Only statements 1 and 3. The UDAN (Ude Desh ka Aam Nagrik) scheme is an initiative by the Indian government aimed at enhancing connectivity to remote and regional areas while making air travel more affordable. The scheme was introduced in 2016 as part of the National Civil Aviation Policy.

question: Which of the following schemes enables students mobility across Higher Education Institutions? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Academic Bank of Credits (ABC) is the initiative of the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) and Ministry of Education (MoE) respectively. It was launched in July 2021.

question: Which is the National Mission for Financial Inclusion to ensure access to financial services, namely, a basic savings and deposits accounts, remittance, credit, insurance, pension in an affordable manner? SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.correct_answer: D. Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana
solution.explanation: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) is a National Mission for Financial Inclusion launched on August 28, 2014.

question: In which year was the Digital India mission launched? SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 2015. The Digital India programme was launched by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi. Aim : To transform India into a knowledge-based economy and a digitally empowered society by ensuring digital services, digital access, digital inclusion, digital empowerment and bridging the digital divide. Coordinated by : Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

question: In which year was Smart Cities Mission launched? SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 2015. It is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme to enhance the quality of life in 100 selected cities by providing efficient services, robust infrastructure, and a sustainable environment. The Central Government has decided to extend the deadline for Smart Cities Mission till 31st March 2025.

question: In Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana, beneficiaries are provided with how much amount every year? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: ₹6,000 - per year in three equal installments, every four months is transferred into the bank accounts of farmers’ families across the country through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode. Implemented by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare. Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana launched on 24th February, 2019.

question: In which year was the MPLADS scheme implemented? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 1993. Objective : The Member of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme (MPLADS) aims to empower MPs to recommend developmental projects that focus on creating durable community assets in areas such as drinking water, primary education, public health, sanitation, and road infrastructure, primarily within their constituencies. Each year, MPs receive ₹5 crore in two installments of ₹2.5 crore each. Notably, the funds allocated under MPLADS are non-lapsable.

question: Under Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana, the maximum premium payable by the farmers will be _________ for all kharif food and oilseeds crops. SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 2%. The Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY), launched on 18 February 2016 by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, is an insurance service for farmers' crops. It follows the "One Nation–One Scheme" concept, replacing the earlier National Agriculture Insurance Scheme and Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme.

question: What is the primary objective of the 'Standup India' initiative? SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

options.C: To facilitate bank loans for SC/ST and
options.D: To support all types of startups

solution.correct_answer: C. To facilitate bank loans for SC/ST and
solution.explanation: Stand-Up India, launched on April 5, 2016, promotes entrepreneurship among women and SC/ST communities. It offers bank loans from ₹10 lakh to ₹1 crore for setting up greenfield enterprises in manufacturing, trading, or services sectors. The initiative aims to foster economic growth and create jobs by supporting marginalized groups in business ventures.

question: Which is the joint digital skills initiative for employability through digital skills by National Career Service and Microsoft India? SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Digisaksham. The DigiSaksham program was launched in 2021. The program was a collaboration between the Ministry of

question: Name the pension scheme that seeks to ensure old age protection for unorganised workers. SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan. This scheme was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2019 to support unorganized sector workers. It offers a monthly pension of ₹3,000 after the age of 60. Workers aged 18 to 40 years, with a monthly income of ₹15,000 or less, and who are not members of EPFO, ESIC, or NPS (government-funded), can enroll in the PM-SYM scheme.

question: Which of the following ministries launched the PM Daksh scheme? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: C. Ministry of Social Justice and
solution.explanation: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. The "Pradhan Mantri Dakshta Aur Kushalta Sampann Hitgrahi" (PM-DAKSH) scheme was launched in 2020-21, and is designed to uplift the marginalized sections of society by offering skill development programs. It targets SC (Scheduled Caste), OBC (Other Backward Classes), Economically Backward Classes, Denotified tribes, and Safai Mitras, providing upskilling, reskilling, short-term training, and entrepreneurial development courses.

question: Under which scheme are collateral free loans of up to ₹10 Lakh extended by the Member Lending Institutions (MLIs) in India? SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana: Launched on April 8, 2015, by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, this flagship scheme aims to provide affordable credit to micro and small enterprises, integrating small entrepreneurs into the formal financial system. The scheme offers three loan products: Shishu (Loans up to ₹50,000), Kishore (Loans ranging from ₹50,000 to ₹500,000), Tarun (Loans from ₹500,000 to ₹1,000,000).

question: The _________ portal is a platform provided by the Govt. of India for farmers to attain any information related to agriculture. SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Farmer’s. The Farmers' Portal is a one-stop platform where farmers can access information on seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, credit, best practices, dealer networks, input availability, beneficiary lists, and weather advisories. Other government portals include the mKisan Portal, Crop Insurance Portal, and Participatory Guarantee System (PGS) Portal of India.

question: The Atal Innovation Mission was launched in the year ________. SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 2016. The Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) objective is to create and promote an ecosystem of innovation and entrepreneurship across the country at school, university, research institution, MSME, and industry levels, with NITI Aayog as the implementing agency. Atal Tinkering Labs, a component of AIM, are state-of-the-art spaces established in schools to foster curiosity and innovation among students from grades 6 to 12.

question: In Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awaas Yojana, the cost of unit assistance is shared between Central and State Governments the ratio ____________ for the North-Eastern and the Himalayan states. SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 90 : 10. Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana : Launched - Urban (25th June 2015) and Gramin (1st April 2016). It is a social welfare programme under the Ministry of Rural Development. Aim - Provide housing for the rural poor in India. The cost of unit assistance is to be shared between Central and State Governments in the ratio 60:40 in plain area.

question: In which year was Ujala Yojana launched? SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 2015. Unnat Jyoti by Affordable LEDs for All (UJALA) : It aims to replace 77 crore incandescent lamps with LED bulbs through phase-wise distribution across India.

question: Which of the following schemes of the Government of India is a part of the ‘Target Group’ approach? SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Marginal Farmers Development Agency (MFDA) supports small and marginal farmers through credit, training, and technology. The Small Farmers Development Agency (SFDA) was established in 1971 by the All India Rural Credit Review Committee, which was formed in 1969. Additionally, the Marginal Farmers and Agricultural Laborers Development Agency (MAFALDA) was established in 1971-72.

question: The National Youth Policy 2014 defines youth as population between the ages of______ and______. SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 15; 29. The National Youth Policy was first formulated in 1988, revised in 2003, and again in 2014. Changes in the socio-economic and other conditions of the country require periodic reformulation to address contemporary issues and promote youth well-being. India has the highest youth population in the world.

question: Which of the following is NOT one of the main pillars of the ‘Namami Gange Programme’, launched by the Government of India in 2014? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: River Linkage Development. The 'Namami Gange Programme' is an integrated conservation mission approved as a flagship program by the Union Government in June 2014.

question: When was the Swarnajayanti Gram Swarozgar Yojana (SGSY) launched by the Government of India? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: 1999. The objective of the SGSY is to bring the assisted Swarozgaris above the poverty line by providing them income generating assets through bank credit and Government subsidy.

question: How might ICT enhance the openness of e-land records? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (3rd shift)

options.A: Enabling quick search and retrieval of
options.D: Reducing the need for land surveys

solution.correct_answer: A. Enabling quick search and retrieval of
solution.explanation: Information and Communication Technology (ICT) facilitates the digitization and online availability of land records, making it easier for stakeholders to access information efficiently. ICT systems can provide real-time updates and tracking of land records, reducing delays and increasing the reliability of information. Digital India Land Records Modernization Programme was launched in 2008 by the Ministry of Rural Development to digitize and modernize land records and develop a centralized land record management system.

question: By which ministry of Government of India was the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana started? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Ministry of Rural Development. Deen Dayal Antyodaya Yojana - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY - NRLM) was launched as ‘Aajeevika - National Rural Livelihoods Mission (NRLM)' in the year 2011. It was renamed as DAY-NRLM in 2015. It aims at creating effective and efficient institutional platforms to enable the rural poor to increase their household income by means of sustainable livelihood enhancements and better access to financial services.

question: When was the Bharat Nirman Programme launched by the Government of India? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: 2005. The Bharat Nirman program was a Union Government program launched to improve rural infrastructure. The program's objectives included: Developing rural roads, Building rural housing, Improving rural telephony, Electrifying rural areas, and Providing rural water supply and irrigation.

question: Which of the following is NOT a poverty alleviation programme in India? SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Rashtriya Ucchatar Shiksha Abhiyan. It is a holistic scheme of development for higher education in India initiated in 2013 by the Ministry of Education. Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rozgar Yojana in India is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme which came into effect on 1 December 1997. The Prime Minister Rozgar Yojna (PMRY) scheme is to provide assistance to the educated unemployed persons.

question: Who among the following launched the digital platform 'FASTER'? SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Chief Justice of India. FASTER, which stands for 'Fast and Secured Transmission of Electronic Records', is a digital platform used by court officials. It enables instant transmission of electronic copies of court orders. This secure electronic communication channel ensures swift delivery of documents to the intended parties. Portals Launched by Government of India : “ROSHNI” - IIT Ropar, Shiksha Vani - CBSE, Diksha - Ministry of Human Resource Development, e-Sahaj - Ministry of Home Affairs.

question: In which year was the ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar’ Yojana launched by the Government of India? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: 2020. The 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rojgar' Yojana has been launched with effect from 1st October, 2020 as part of Atmanirbhar Bharat package 3.0 to incentivize employers for creation of new employment along with social security benefits and restoration of loss of employment during Covid-19 pandemic.

question: __________ is one of the well - known schemes sponsored by the Union Government of India. It was launched in November 2015 with the aim of rescuing the country’s ailing electricity distribution companies. SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Ujwal DISCOM Assurance Yojana. Key Features of UDAY: Financial Turnaround: Allows state governments to take over 75% of DISCOM debt and pay back lenders by selling bonds. Energy Efficiency: Promotes the use of energy-efficient LED bulbs, agricultural pumps, fans, and air conditioners. Other Scheme: One Nation, One Grid refers to the unified national power grid. Integrated Power Development Scheme (IPDS) focuses on strengthening sub-transmission and distribution infrastructure. Deendayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojana (DDUGJY) aims to provide 24/7 electricity to rural areas.

question: The approach driven by seven engines, which is powered by Clean Energy and 'Sabka Prayas' is related to which scheme? SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.correct_answer: D. PM Gati Shakti Master Plan
solution.explanation: PM Gati Shakti Master Plan. Launched on October 13, 2021, the PM Gati Shakti plan is aimed at integrating and speeding up infrastructure projects across sectors. It focuses on seven key engines: roads, railways, airports, ports, mass transport, waterways, and logistics infrastructure.

question: Match the columns. List I List II i. National Manufacturing Policy a. 2014 ii. Make in India initiative b. 2016 iii. Startup India scheme c. 2011 iv. Smart City Project d. 2015 SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (3rd shift)

options.A: i - d, ii - c, iii - a, iv - b
options.B: i - c, ii - d, iii - b, iv - a
options.C: i - b, ii - a, iii - d, iv - c
options.D: i - c, ii - a, iii - b, iv - d

solution.correct_answer: D. i - c, ii - a, iii - b, iv - d
solution.explanation: i-c, ii-a, iii-b, iv-d. National Manufacturing Policy: Objective - Enhancing the share of manufacturing in GDP to 25% within a decade and creating 100 million jobs. Make in India initiative: Objective - To promote India as the most preferred global manufacturing destination. Startup India scheme: Aim - To empower startups to grow through innovation and design. Smart City Project: Objective: To promote sustainable and inclusive cities with core infrastructure, a high quality of life, a clean environment, and smart solutions.

question: When was the Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) launched? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: 2008. The Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a government scheme that aims to create employment opportunities in rural and urban areas. The scheme provides financial assistance for setting up self-employment ventures, including for artisans and unemployed youth.

question: In which year was the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act passed? SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: 2005. The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) was enacted in September 2005, with the primary objective of ensuring 100 days of wage employment per year for rural households. Originally proposed by P.V. Narasimha Rao in 1991, it was implemented across 625 districts in India before its nomenclature was amended from NREGA to MGNREGA on 2nd October 2009 .

question: The ___________ project has been organised by the Central government for the villagers, to conserve water for drinking, irrigation, fisheries and afforestation. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Haryali : Launched in 2003. Chipko movement (1973) was a nonviolent protest to prevent felling of trees in Himalayas that began in Chamoli (Uttarakhand) under the leadership of Sundarlal Bahuguna, Gaura Devi, etc. The Neeru-Meeru (Water and You) programme was launched in Andhra Pradesh in 2000. Arvary Pani Sansad (in Alwar, Rajasthan) program was launched in 1999.

question: Which Ministry of the Government of India launched South Asia Distribution Utility Network (SADUN) which aims to modernise distribution of utilities in South Asia? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Power Ministry. SADUN is a joint initiative of the Ministry of Power, United States Agency for International Development (USAID) and Power Finance Corp. This initiative aims to promote knowledge sharing among distribution companies (discoms) in the region.

question: In which year was the 'Prime Minister Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi' (PM SVANidhi) scheme launched by the Government of India with the objective of providing an affordable working capital loan to street vendors to resume their livelihoods ? Matriculation Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: 2020. Prime Minister Street Vendor’s AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM-SVANidhi) fully funded by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. The scheme facilitates a working capital collateral-free loan of ₹10,000, with subsequent loans of ₹20,000 and ₹50,000 with a 7% interest subsidy.

question: The 'National Food for Work Programme' was launched in the year 2004 by the Government of India in _____ most backward districts of India. Matriculation Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: 150. The National Food for Work Programme (NFWP), launched on November 14, 2004, by the Ministry of Rural Development, aimed to provide supplementary wage employment in 150 of India's most backward districts.

question: Pradhan Mantri Virasat Ka Samvardhan (PM VIKAS) Scheme is a scheme of which Ministry of the Government of India? Higher Secondary 25/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: Ministry of Minority Affairs. Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Ko Kaam Karyakram (PMKKK) renamed as Pradhan Mantri Virasat Ka Samvardhan (PM VIKAS) Scheme. This integrated scheme converges five erstwhile schemes of the Ministry viz. Seekho aur Kamao, USTTAD, Hamari Dharohar, Nai Roshni and Nai Manzil.

question: In October 2020, which of the following Ministries launched the Ayushman Sahakar Scheme, to assist cooperatives in the creation of healthcare infrastructure? Graduate Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

options.B: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare

solution.correct_answer: C. Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers
solution.explanation: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare. The scheme is implemented by the National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC). Other related schemes include Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB-PMJAY), launched by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare in September 2018, and the National Rural Health Mission (NRHM), initiated by the same ministry in 2005.

question: Which of the following is NOT a poverty alleviation programme in India? Graduate Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Namami Gange. India has implemented several poverty alleviation programs aimed at reducing poverty and improving living standards. Poverty alleviation programme in India: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment

question: What is the duration of Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana? Graduate Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: 5 years. The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) was launched in 2020, by the Department of Fisheries, Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry, and Dairying.

question: Which of the following government schemes was launched to provide financial assistance to start-ups for proof of concept, prototype development, product trials, market entry and commercialisation on 19 April 2021? Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.correct_answer: A. Start-up India Seed Fund Scheme
solution.explanation: Start-up India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS) aims to provide seed funding to startups at the initial stages. Pradhan Mantri Rozgar Yojana (1993) focuses on self-employment opportunities for unemployed youth. Procurement and Marketing Support (PMS) Scheme provides marketing assistance to micro and small enterprises. Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (2015) provides loans to micro-enterprises.

question: Which ministry started the Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan Yojana? Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.correct_answer: A. Ministry of Labour and Employment
solution.explanation: Ministry of Labour and Employment. Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan Yojana (PMRPY) was launched on 9th August, 2016 with the objective to incentivise employers for creation of employment. Under the scheme, Government of India is paying Employer’s full contribution i.e. 12% towards Employees' Provident Funds (EPF) and Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS) both.

question: The Swadesh Darshan Scheme (SDS) which was launched in 2014-15 by the Ministry of Tourism, Government of India, has been revamped as ___ in 2023. SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Swadesh Darshan 2.0 (SD2.0). It seeks to attain “Aatmanirbhar Bharat” with the mantra of ‘vocal for local’.

question: Which age group of the population are covered under the Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY) scheme of the Government of India ? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 15 to 35 years. Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalyaya Yojana (Launch - 2014) : It is a demand-driven placement linked skill training initiative working under the National Rural Livelihood Mission (NRLM). Scheme was announced by the Ministry of Rural Development on Antyodaya Divas.

question: In which year was the Training of Rural Youth for Self Employment (TRYSEM) scheme launched by the Government of India? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 1979. Objectives of TRYSEM : To provide rural youth (18-35 years) from families below the poverty line with training and technical skills to enable them to take up self-employment in agriculture, industry, services and business activities.

question: The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rojgar Yojana (SJSRY) was launched in the year ____ by the Government of India. SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 1997. SJSRY : The Swarna Jayanti Shahari Rozgar Yojana (SJSRY) shall seek to provide gainful employment to the urban unemployed. Ministry - Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.

question: The Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan (PMGKRA) was launched in the year 2020 by which Ministry of Government of India? SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.C: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium

solution.explanation: Ministry of Rural Development. It was for a period of 125 days with a resource envelope of Rs.50,000 crore, to boost employment and livelihood opportunities for returnee migrant workers and similarly affected workers in the rural area, in the wake of COVID-19 pandemic. It will run for 125 days in 116 districts across six states - Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, Odisha and Rajasthan.

question: In which year was the Pradhan Mantri Rojgar Protsahan Yojana (PMRPY) launched? SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 2016. PMRPY : a scheme to incentivise employers registered with the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) for job creation. Administered by - The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). Nodal Ministry - Ministry of Labour and Employment.

question: Which of the following options best describes the purpose of Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Mann-Dhan (PM-SYM) scheme, 2019 ? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan Dhan (PM-SYM) scheme - The scheme provides a monthly pension of Rs. 3000/- to subscribers after they attain the age of 60 years. The scheme is for the age group of 18-40 years.

question: Which of the following government schemes provides subsidised food grains to poor households in India? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (4th shift)

solution.correct_answer: B. Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna
solution.explanation: Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (2020). The scheme aims to provide 5 kg of grains (wheat or rice) for free to each individual who is covered under National Food Security Act, 2013.

question: Which of the following initiatives of the Government of India is aimed at developing and rejuvenating 75 water bodies in each district of the country as a part of the celebration of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Mission Amrit Sarovar. With a view to conserve water for the future this Mission launched on 24th April, 2022.

question: Which of the following is the largest pan-India scheme to strengthen health care infrastructure across the country with focus on primary, secondary and tertiary care services? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: PM-ABHIM (Prime Minister Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission): Ministry ( Ministry of Health and Family Welfare), launched (October 2021).

question: The 'Right to Work' plan, under the National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, 2005, was implemented in how many districts in the first phase? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: 200. National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, 2005 (NREGA) : It is under the Ministry of Rural development. In (2009), the NREGA scheme was renamed as the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) scheme. Aim - to ensure that if any adult member of a rural household is willing to do unskilled manual work, that household gets at least 100 days of jobs in a financial year.

question: What is the priority zone of the AMRUT (Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation) mission, which was launched by the Government of India in 2015 ? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. Water supply followed by sewerage
solution.explanation: Water supply followed by sewerage. AMRUT: Launched on 25th June 2015 and selected 500 cities and towns to focus on development of basic infrastructure. National Heritage City Development And Augmentation Yojana (HRIDAY) started on 21 January 2015.

question: What is the name of the flagship program that was launched in 2005 to address the lack of infrastructure in urban India ? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission (JNNURM) - A massive city-modernization scheme launched by the Government of India under the Ministry of Urban Development. Launched - December 2005. Closed - 2014.

question: When was the National Urban Health Mission approved by the Government of India ? SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: 2013. The National Urban Health Mission (NUHM): Launched by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

question: In which year was the 'Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana' launched? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: 2015. Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana: promotes skill development in the country by providing free short-duration skill training and incentivizes this by providing monetary rewards to youth for skill certification. Ministry - Skill Development and Entrepreneurship.

question: The 'Jal Kranti Abhiyan' was launched by which government during the financial year 2015 - 2016 ? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 1st shift)

solution.explanation: Government of India. The Abhiyan was inaugurated by the Union Minister of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation in Rajasthan in June 2015. Objective: Strengthening grass-root involvement of all stakeholders including Panchayati Raj institutions and local bodies for Participatory Irrigation Management.

question: 'Swachh Bharat Mission' is associated with which public figure? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi. Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM) is a country-wide campaign initiated by the Government of India at Rajpath (New Delhi) on October 2, 2014 to eliminate open defecation and improve solid waste management.

question: How many engines drive 'PM Gati Shakti', a project launched by the central government with an aim to revolutionise infrastructure in India? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Seven. Gati Shakti scheme (2021) or National Master Plan for multi-modal connectivity plan comes under the Ministry of Commerce.

question: What is the aim of the Annapurna Yojana of the Government of India? Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

options.A: To provide food grains to children
options.B: To provide food grains to women
options.D: To provide food grains to senior citizens

question: Karmayogi Bharat owns and operates the digital assets and platforms for the online training of _____________ . Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2) www.ssccglpinnacle.com Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Static GK

solution.explanation: Civil servants. Karmayogi Bharat : A Special Purpose Vehicle (set up under section 8 of Companies Act, 2013 as a 100% government-owned entity) which shall own, manage, maintain and improve the digital platform, IGOT (Integrated Govt. Online training) to implement Mission Karmayogi (2020) - the National Programme for Civil Services Capacity Building.

question: The National Rural Employment Programme was merged with ____ in 1989. SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Jawahar Rozgar Yojana - It was launched in April 1989 by merging National Rural Employment Program (NREP) and Rural Landless Employment Guarantee Programme (RLEGP). It was replaced by Jawahar Gram Samridhi Yojna on 1 April 1999 and on 25 September 2001, merged with Sampoorna Grameen Rozgar Yojana. Indira Awaas Yojana (IAY) - 1985-86 (Now replaced by Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana).

question: Pradhan Mantri Gramodaya Yojana was launched in ___________. SSC MTS 04/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 2000. Pradhan Mantri Gramodaya Yojana - It was started to improve the lives of the rural poor population. Other important government scheme: National Social Assistance Programme (Launched on 15th August, 1995). Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (Launched on 25th December, 2000). Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (October 2014). Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (launched in 2016).

question: PM Street Vendor’s AtmaNirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi) Scheme was launched by which ministry? SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Morning)

options.D: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

solution.correct_answer: D. Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
solution.explanation: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. The PM Street Vendor’s Atma Nirbhar Nidhi (PM SVANidhi) - launched on June 01, 2020. Aim - Providing affordable Working Capital loans to street vendors to resume their livelihoods that have been adversely affected due to Covid-19 lockdown.

question: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Urban was launched by which Union Ministry? SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Evening)

solution.correct_answer: B. Ministry of Housing and Urban
solution.explanation: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs. It was launched on 25th June 2015. Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G) - It was launched in June 2015 with the aim to provide ‘Housing for All’ by 2022 in rural areas.

question: The Union Government's "PAHAL Scheme" is related to _______ . SSC MTS 17/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: LPG Subsidy. PAHAL (Pratyaksh Hanstantrit Labh) entered into Guinness Book of World Records (largest Direct Benefit Transfer of LPG), was launched on 01 June 2013 by the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas.

question: The National Literacy Mission (NLM) was set up in _____ . SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 1988. The National Literacy Mission - It aimed to educate people in the age group of 15 - 35. The major aim of the programme is on the promotion of literacy among women, scheduled castes and tribes and backward classes.

question: “PM POSHAN” Scheme is implemented by which ministry? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Ministry of Education. In 2021, the Union Cabinet approved the PM-POSHAN (Pradhan Mantri Poshan Shakti Nirman) for providing one hot cooked meal in Government and Government-aided schools. The scheme replaced the Mid-day Meal Scheme. The Mid Day Meal Scheme was started in India on 15th August 1995.

question: Which road plan in India was the first attempt for the Road Development Programme between 1943-1963 ? SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Nagpur Road plan (1943 - 1963). Bombay road plan (1961- 1981, Lucknow road plan (1981 – 2001).

question: In which of the following years was the Fit India Movement launched by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, GoI? SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 2019. Fit India Movement was launched on the occasion of National Sports Day to make fitness an integral part of the daily lives of the people of India.

question: Smart cities and Academia Towards Action and Research (SAAR) scheme was launched by the ______. SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Afternoon)

options.C: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

solution.correct_answer: C. Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
solution.explanation: The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) launched the SAAR program under the Smart Cities Mission.

question: In which year was Soil Health Card launched in India to enable the farmers to apply appropriate recommended dosages of nutrients for crop production and improving soil health and its fertility? Graduate Level 02/08/2022 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: 2015 (Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare). Soil Health Card (SHC) is a printed report which contains nutrient status of soil with respect to 12 nutrients: pH, Electrical Conductivity (EC), Organic Carbon (OC), Nitrogen (N), Phosphorus (P), Potassium (K), Sulphur (S), Zinc (Zn), Boron (B), Iron (Fe), Manganese (Mn) and Copper (Cu) of farm holdings.

question: When was the Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission launched? Graduate Level 02/08/2022 (Shift - 3 )

solution.explanation: 27 September 2021. Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission aims to provide digital health IDs for all Indian citizens to help hospitals, insurance firms, and citizens access health records electronically when required.

question: ‘Surakshit Hum Surakshit Tum Abhiyan’ was launched by which of the following institutions? Graduate Level 04/08/2022 (Shift - 2)

options.A: NITI Aayog and bill and Melinda

solution.correct_answer: D. NITI Aayog and Piramal Foundation
solution.explanation: NITI Aayog and Piramal Foundation. NITI stands for “National Institution for Transforming India” (2015). Its initiatives include "15-year road map", "7-year vision, strategy, and action plan", AMRUT, Digital India, Atal Innovation Mission.

question: In which year was the Immunization Programme introduced in India as ‘Expanded Programme of Immunization’ (EPI) by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare? SSC CGL 13/04/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 1978. The Expanded Programme on Immunization (EPI) was started in India in 1978 with the objective to reduce morbidity and mortality from tetanus, poliomyelitis, diphtheria, pertussis, and childhood tuberculosis by providing immunization services to all eligible children and pregnant women by 1990.

question: Realizing the importance of maintaining the cleanliness of the water bodies, the Government of India passed the Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, ________, to safeguard our water resources. SSC CGL 21/04/2022 (Evening)
In which year was the ‘Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan’ (PM AASHA) launched by the Government of India? SSC MTS 18/10/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 2018. The ‘Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan’ (PM AASHA) was launched by the Government of India. Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay SanraksHan Abhiyan (PM-AASHA) is an umbrella scheme aimed at ensuring remunerative prices to the farmers for their produce.

question: ‘Mission Antyodaya’ is a mission mode project envisaged by the: SSC MTS 02/11/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Ministry of Rural Development. Mission Antyodaya is a convergence and accountability framework aiming to bring optimum use and management of resources. It was adopted in the Union Budget 2017-18.

question: In which year was the ‘Target Olympic Podium Scheme’ (‘TOPS’) formulated by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports? SSC CGL 24/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 2014. TOPS facilitates selected athletes with support staff and training personnel, sports psychologists, physiotherapists etc including direct financial support of 50,000 rupees per month.

question: In which year was National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) registered as a society under the Societies Registration Act 1860? SSC CHSL 15/04/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 2011. National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) is the implementation wing of the National Ganga River Basin Authority (NGRBA). Miscellaneous

question: Chand Minar at Daulatabad is a 210-feet-high tapering tower divided into _____ storeys. SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: four. Chand Minar (2nd largest minaret in India) was built in 1435 by Ala-ud-din Bahmani to commemorate the victory over the Daulatabad Fort. It has 24 chambers, spread over four floors and a small mosque.

question: Theravada is known as the official religion of which of the following neighbouring countries of India? SSC MTS 04/11/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Sri Lanka. Theravāda is one of the major branches of Buddhism, and it is considered the oldest and most traditional form. It is predominantly practiced in Southeast Asian countries such as Sri Lanka, Thailand, Myanmar (Burma), Laos, and Cambodia. Official religion of India’s Neighbouring Countries: Pakistan (Islam), Bangladesh (Islam), Bhutan (Mahayana Buddhism), Afghanistan (Islam).

question: The Kamakshi Saunsthan temple of Goa is crowned with the ________ two-storied tower and with a golden Kalash perched on its Shikhar. SSC MTS 12/11/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: octagonal. The Kamakshi Saunsthan temple, built in the late 16th century, is located in the village of Shiroda, Goa. The temple complex, known as 'Sthal' or 'Thal', is accessed through a grand Mahadwar (temple gate) and includes key features like Sabha Mandap (entrance hall), Deepasthambh (lamp tower), a holy water tank, and a square-shaped chowk for Prasad rituals.

question: Consider the following statements related to the Online Dispute Resolution (ODR) handbook. 1. It will be launched by the Ministry of Science and Technology. 2. ODR is the resolution for cases outside courts using digital technology and techniques of Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR), such as negotiation, mediation and arbitration. 3. The development of ICT and increased use of internet has played a major role for ODR. Which of the given statements is/are correct? SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Only 2 and 3. Online Dispute Resolution handbook is launched by NITI Ayog. It is developed by Agami

question: How is the structure of health infrastructure and health care system in India? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Three-tier system. The healthcare system in India is a three-tier structure, with Sub Health Centres, Primary Health Centres, and Community Health Centres, both in urban and rural areas, serving as the pillars of the primary health care system.

question: Which language is known as ‘Italian of the East’ ? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Telugu. Telugu Language Day is celebrated every year on August 29. In 2008, Telugu was granted the status of a classical language. Nicolo di Conti, who visited the Vijayanagara Empire, found that the words in the Telugu language end with vowels, just like those in Italian, and hence referred to it as "The Italian of the East”.

question: To enhance the interoperability between the Indian and Russian Armies, a joint training exercise called _________ commenced at Prudboy Ranges, Volgograd in the year 2021. SSC CHSL 02/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: INDRA 2021. 12th Edition of Indo-Russia Joint Military Exercise INDRA 2021 : Objective - Conduct counter-terror operations under UN mandate. Participation - 250 personnel from India and Russia. Indian Army Contingent - Mechanised Infantry Battalion. The 13th edition of the Indra naval exercise was hosted by India in the Bay of Bengal in November 2023.

question: What kind of technology is most frequently used to manage and digitise e-land records? SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Geographic Information System (GIS) allows for the effective mapping, analysis, and management of land data by integrating spatial and attribute information. It provides tools for creating detailed maps, analyzing land use patterns, and managing land records efficiently. Blockchain technology can enhance security and transparency, and VR and AR have potential applications.

question: On 12 September 2002, ISRO launched the Kalpana-1 satellite using the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle. What is the application of this satellite? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Climate & environment communication. Kalpana-1 satellite was originally known as MetSat-1. Launched by vehicle PSLV - C4. On February 5, 2003 it was renamed to Kalpana-1 by the Indian Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee in memory of Kalpana Chawla (NASA astronaut who perished in the Space Shuttle Columbia disaster).

question: In whose ashram did the Beatles compose rock music in 1968 influenced by classical music? SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Maharshi Mahesh Yogi Ashram. In February 1968, the English rock band the Beatles traveled to Rishikesh (Uttarakhand) to take part in a Transcendental Meditation (TM) training course at Maharshi Mahesh Yogi's Ashram. Maharshi Mahesh Yogi is the founder of the Transcendental Meditation technique.

question: The institute established by Kaka Hathrasi in 1932 is: SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Sangeet Karyalaya: Located - Hathras (Uttar Pradesh). The institute was founded with the aim of promoting Indian classical music and preserving the cultural heritage of India. Kaka Hathrasi published the monthly magazine "SANGEET" in 1935.

question: Marathi language is in the_______language family SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Indo Aryan. Marathi is a language spoken in the Indian state of Maharashtra and belongs to the Indo-Aryan branch of the Indo-European language family. It is closely related to languages such as Hindi, Gujarati, and Punjabi. Austric: These are the languages spoken by the Munda or Kol group and spoken in central, eastern, and northeastern India.

question: With which of the following communities is the word 'Langar' (community kitchen) mainly associated? SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Sikhism. The concept of “Langar” is an integral part of Sikh culture, symbolizing equality, service, and community bonding. It is commonly served at Gurdwaras (Sikh temples) and was introduced by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Similar tradition of Annadanam (food donation) exist in Hinduism.

question: Which of the following is NOT one of the classical languages of India? SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Magahi (Magadhi) is an Indo-Aryan language spoken in Bihar, Jharkhand and West Bengal states of eastern India, and in the Terai of Nepal. All the Classical Languages are listed in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution. Six languages that enjoy the ‘Classical’ status in India: Tamil (declared in 2004), Sanskrit (2005), Kannada (2008), Telugu (2008), Malayalam (2013), and Odia (2014).

question: Oil India Limited (OIL) is under the administrative structure of: SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.correct_answer: D. Ministry of Petroleum and Natural .
solution.explanation: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas. Oil India Limited (OIL) is a Maharatna company. Headquarter - Noida. Established - 1959. For a

question: In which year was the National Human Rights Commission established in India? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: 1993. The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) was established on October 12, 1993. Its statute is contained in the Protection of Human Rights Act, 1993, and is in conformity with the Paris Principles, adopted for promoting and protecting human rights. Section 2 (d) of the Protection of Human Rights Act, 1993 defines human rights as rights relating to life, liberty, equality and dignity of the individual, guaranteed by the Constitution.

question: Annamacharya composed Sankirtans in praise of which God? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Lord Venkateshwara. Annamacharya was a Telugu musician, composer, and a Hindu saint. The Sri Venkateswara Swami Temple is a Hindu temple situated in the hills of Tirumala at Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh.

question: Which is the only surviving specimen of the ancient Sanskrit theatre recognised by UNESCO as a Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity? SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: Kutiyattam. It blends Sanskrit classicism with Kerala's local traditions, featuring expressive eye movements (neta abhinaya) and gestures (hasta abhinaya). Traditionally, it is performed in Kuttampalams, theaters found in Hindu temples.

question: The UIDAI is under the jurisdiction of which of the following ministries? SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology. Aadhaar card is a 12-digit unique identification number issued by the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) to every individual resident of India. It serves as proof of identity, which is linked to the individual's biometric and demographic information. The Aadhaar programme was launched in 2009 by the UIDAI with the goal of providing a unique and verifiable identity for every resident of India.

question: Which of the following statements is/are correct? I- Radio broadcasting started in India in 1923 by the Radio Club of Bombay. II- All India Radio came into being in 1936. III - In 1976, TV was delinked from All India Radio (AIR) and got a separate identity as Door darshan (DD). SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift)

options.A: I, II and III are correct
options.B: Both I and II are correct.
options.C: Both II and III are correct.

solution.correct_answer: A. I, II and III are correct
solution.explanation: I, II and III are correct. Radio broadcasting was changed to All India Radio (AIR) in 1936 and to Akashwani in 1957. AIR (Akashvani) is India's national public radio broadcaster. It was owned by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting. AIR originated programming in 23 languages and 179 dialects.

question: Who was the Indian Buddhist monk who is credited with the development of many ancient martial art forms in the 5th century? SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: Bodhidharma. He was a semi-legendary Buddhist monk who lived during the 5th or 6th century CE. In Indian philosophy, he is commonly considered the founder of Chan Buddhism in China. It was later known as Zen in Japan. Bodhidharma is also credited with founding the famous Shaolin school of Chinese martial arts. He is known as a Tripitaka Dharma Master.

question: In which of the following regions of India is the Mundari language spoken? SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Chota-Nagpur plateau. This plateau covers parts of Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and West Bengal. Mundari is a Munda language, belonging to the Austroasiatic language family. Chhota Nagpur plateau is called the “Heart of industrial India” because it is rich in minerals and power fuels. The highest mountain peak of Chota Nagpur Plateau is Parasnath.

question: Which is an advanced weather satellite of India configured with improved imaging system and atmospheric sounder ? SSC CPO 29/06/2024 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: INSAT - 3D: Launched - 2013; Launch Vehicle - Ariane-5 VA-214. Important Satellites: SARAL (2013): Climate & Environment, Earth Observation. RISAT-1 (2012): Earth Observation. RISAT-2 (2009): Earth Observation. Bhaskara-I (1979): Earth Observation, Experimental. GSAT-7A (2018): Communication. Rohini Satellite RS-D1 (1981): Earth Observation.

question: Rajasthani architecture is also known as: Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Maru-Gurjara architecture. This style of architecture evolved in the region of Rajasthan and Gujarat, blending regional traditions with elements of Hindu, Jain, and Mughal architecture. The term "Maru" refers to the desert region (Marwar) of Rajasthan, and "Gurjara" refers to the region of Gujarat, highlighting the cultural influence from both areas.

question: Sashastra Seema Bal is the lead intelligence unit for the_________and Bhutan borders and the coordinating agency for national security activities. Matriculation Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Nepal. Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) was established as the Special Service Bureau in May 1963. Headquarter - New Delhi. Motto - Service, Security and Brotherhood. The Border Security Force (BSF) is responsible for the Bangladesh and Pakistan borders, while the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) oversees the border with China.

question: Which geostationary weather satellite launched by the European Space Agency in 1977 that provides weather imaging of Earth at both visible light and infrared wavelengths? Higher Secondary 26/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Meteosat - The first European geostationary weather satellite, launched in November 1977 by the European Space Agency (ESA). Himawari is a Japanese weather satellite series. QuikSCAT was a NASA satellite that measured ocean winds. Landsat is a series of Earth observation satellites focused on land use, geology, and natural resources, not specifically weather imaging.

question: ________ is a mode of communication in itself, and it also regulates the use of other means of communication. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Satellite. On the basis of configuration and purposes, satellite systems in India can be grouped into two: Indian National Satellite System (INSAT, established in 1983) and Indian Remote Sensing Satellite System (IRS, established in 1988). A communication satellite is an artificial satellite that amplifies and relays radio signals between a transmitter and receiver on Earth. Notable communication satellites: GSAT-31; GSAT-7A; GSAT-11; EDUSAT.

question: Who among the following designed the India Gate ? SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Edwin Lutyens. India Gate was constructed in 1931. The India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Kartavya path (formerly Raj path) on the eastern edge of the ‘ceremonial axis’ of New Delhi.

question: The Rajgir Zoo is located in which of the following states? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Bihar. Zoos in India : Sri Chamarajendra Zoological Gardens (Karnataka), Nandankanan Zoological Park (Odisha), Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park (Maharashtra).

question: What was the style of architecture used in Laxmi Vilas Palace of Vadodara, Gujarat ? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: Indo-Saracenic. Laxmi Vilas Palace of Vadodara was built by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1890.

question: Rani - Ki - Vav (the Queen's stepwell) is situated on the banks of which river ? SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Saraswati. Rani-ki-Vav (UNESCO World Heritage Site) - Its construction is attributed to Udayamati (the spouse of the 11th-century Chaulukya king Bhima - 1) in Patan (Gujarat). It is on the new 100 rupee note (coloured Lavender).

question: The famous Sheesh Mahal in Punjab was built by which of the following rulers? SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Maharaja Narinder Singh. Sheesh Mahal - It is located in Patiala (Punjab).

question: How many UNESCO Natural World Heritage sites are there in India? SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Seven. UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) World Heritage Convention which was established in 1972.

question: Lomas Rishi cave is situated in which of the following Hills? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Barabar Hills (Bihar). It was constructed by emperor Ashoka for the use of Ajivaka. Buddhist, Hindu and Jain sculptures are also found there. It includes four caves - Lomas Rishi Caves, Sudama caves, Vishwakarma Caves, and Karan Chaupar caves. The Barabar Hill Caves are the oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India.

question: Rabindranath Tagore started Shantiniketan institute in ___________. SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 1901. Santiniketan literally means “abode of peace” in Bengali.

question: Which of the following is NOT a family in classification of Modern Indian Languages ? SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Indo-african. People of India speak a large number of languages which are broadly divided into the following four families: Indo-European Family (Arya), Dravidian Family (Dravida), Austric Family (Nishada), and Sino Tibetan Family (Kirata).

question: Who hosted the first meeting of India-Central Asia Summit? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: India. Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi hosted the first meeting of the India-Central Asia Summit on 27 January 2022.

question: India’s short-range Ballistic Missile, Prithvi Il was successfully test fired from _____. SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Chandipur, Odisha. Submarine Launched Ballistic Missiles - Ashwin, Sagarika, K-4 and K-5. Surface -to-surface Missiles - Prithvi I, Prithvi II, Agni (I - V), Dhanush, Prahar and Shaurya (Medium-Range Ballistic Missile).

question: The world's highest motorable road passes through_________pass in India, as of 2022. SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Umling La. It connects Chisumle and Demchok village. The Border Roads Organization (BRO) has constructed the road at an altitude of 19,300 feet. Highest motorable roads in India - Dungri La (Uttarakhand,18,406 ft), Marsimik La (Jammu & Kashmir, 18,314 ft), Donkia La (Sikkim,18,045 ft), Photi La, (Jammu & Kashmir - 18,124 ft), Khardung La (Jammu & Kashmir - 17,583 ft) etc.

question: Market Based Economic Dispatch (MBED) Mechanism is related with which of the following ministry? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.D: Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium

solution.explanation: The Ministry of Power. The Electricity Act, 2003 - An Act to consolidate the laws relating to generation, transmission, distribution, trading and use of electricity.

question: Intermediate Range Ballistic Missile Agni-4 has been successfully test fired in _________. SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: D. APJ Abdul Kalam Island, Odisha
solution.explanation: APJ Abdul Kalam Island, Odisha. The Agni-IV (range 4000 Km) is a two-stage surface-to-surface missile. It has been developed by DRDO (Defence Research and Development Organisation).

question: Which among the following is a surface-to-surface missile of India? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Agni V {(range around 5000 km - 5500 km), developed by Defence Research and Development Organisation} is a ballistic missile developed under the Integrated Guided Missile Development Programme (IGMDP). On October 27, 2021, (test fired on) the country celebrated 75th infantry day. The missiles developed under IGMDP (established in 1983) are Prithvi, Agni, Trishul, Akash, Nag.

question: The S-400 Triumf (Russian for Triumph) Missile System is _____ missile defence system designed in Russia. SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: surface - to - air. This System is an anti-aircraft missile defence system developed by Russia's Almaz Central Design Bureau.

question: “Statue of Equality” has been inaugurated in Hyderabad in the memory of ________ . SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Saint Ramanujacharya. Statue of Equality: Height - 216 feet. Material - Panchaloha. Statue of Unity - Tallest statue in world - 182 meters - Located in Kevadia, Narmada District, Gujarat. Swami Vivekanand Statue - 33 ft tall - Ranchi Jharkhand.

question: Chandigarh International Airport has been renamed as__________ SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: Shaheed Bhagat Singh International Airport (Chandigarh‎, ‎Punjab)‎. Guru Gobind Singh Airport (Maharashtra). Amritsar International Airport renamed as Sri Guru Ram Das Jee International Airport (Amritsar, Punjab). Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport (Kolkata). Bharat Ratna Babasaheb Dr. B.R. Ambedkar International Airport (Nagpur, Maharashtra).

question: When was the None of the Above (NOTA) ballot option first implemented in India? SSC CGL Tier II 07/03/2023

solution.explanation: 2013. "None of the above" (NOTA): It does not hold any electoral value, it allows the voter to indicate disapproval of all of the candidates, it does not provide for a ‘right to reject’.

question: When was 'Vayudoot' airline setup in India? SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 1981. The airline was headquartered at New Delhi's Safdarjung Airport. It ceased operations on 1 April 1997. Air India (J.R.D Tata , 1932,). Kingfisher airlines (Vijay Mallya, 2003, Ceased operations: 20 October 2012).

question: The railway system connecting St - Petersburg to Vladivostok is _________. SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: The Trans-Siberian Railway is the longest railway system connecting St. Petersburg in Western Russia to Vladivostok on the Pacific coast. India's longest distance train (Vivek Express - Dibrugarh to Kanyakumari-4189 km).

question: At present, the Grand Trunk Road extends from___________ in India. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Amritsar to Kolkata. Grand Trunk Road was built by Sher Shah Suri in the 16th century. National Highway 1 is known as Sher Shah Suri Marg.

question: Which city is called the ‘Manchester of India’? SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Ahmedabad - Boston of East' . Visakhapatnam - City of Destiny,. Jaipur - Pink City. Surat - Silk City of India, Diamond City of India. Akola - Cotton City of India. Coorg (Karnataka) - Scotland of India.

question: The National Archives of India came up in the ______. SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 1920s. The Imperial Record Department (Now- The National Archives of India) was set up on 11 March 1891 in Calcutta (Kolkata). In 1926 the Department was shifted into its new building in New Delhi. It is the biggest archival repository in South Asia.

question: Which of the following statements is/are true about the communication development in India? A. TV services began in India before Independence. B. TV was delinked from All India Radio. C. Doordarshan got a separate identity in 1976. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Morning)

options.C: Both A and C (d) Both B and C

solution.explanation: Both B and C. Television started in India on September 15, 1959.

question: Air transport was launched in India in the year 1911 between which two places? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Allahabad and Naini (short distance of 10km). Indian National Airways (1933, between Karachi and Lahore). Airports Authority of India {Founded (1 April 1995), Headquarters (New Delhi), Longest air route in India {Srinagar ( J&K ) to Port Blair ( Andaman and Nicobar )}.

question: What was the former name of the Yamuna Expressway Project constructed in Uttar Pradesh, India? SSC MTS 08/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Taj Expressway. It is presently India's 3rd longest expressway since February 2017.

question: Which of the following is the first six-lane expressway in India? SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Mumbai Pune Expressway. Purvanchal Expressway (Lucknow- Ghazipur).Yamuna Expressway (Noida to Agra).

question: The Barabati Fort is situated in the city of. SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Cuttack. More Forts in Odisha: Chudanga Gada Fort (Bhubaneswar), Raibania Fort (Baleswar district), Sisupalgarh Fort (Bhubaneswar), Asurgarh Fort (Kalahandi district), Potagarh Fort. Gulbarga Fort - Karnataka.

question: The aviation sector was inaugurated in India in the year _____ with the establishment of Tata Airlines. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 1932 . The airline, founded by J.R.D Tata, started as an airmail carrier within India after winning a contract with Imperial Airways. The airline flew its inaugural flight in October 1932, flying from Karachi to Mumbai.

question: Who among the following founded the ‘Shillong Chamber Choir’ ? SSC CHSL 07/06/2022 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Neil Nongkinrih. The Shillong Chamber Choir, established in 2001, is a multi-genre choir, which won the reality TV show India's Got Talent in 2010.

question: In which year was the ‘Lotteries Regulation Act’ passed? SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Morning)

solution.explanation: 1998. The Lotteries Regulation Act, 1998 is an important piece of legislation that lays down thorough guidelines for the central government to conduct lotteries in India.

question: Which of the following is an indigenous dairy breed of cattle? SSC CGL 12/04/2022(Evening)

solution.explanation: Red Sindhi is a reputed heat tolerant milch cattle breed originating from Sindh province of Pakistan. The Chippiparai is a breed of sighthound from Tamil Nadu in southern India. The Kanni is a rare indigenous South Indian sighthound breed of dog. The Kombai or Polygar dog is a breed of sighthound native to Tamil Nadu.

question: ______ is one of the languages in which the denomination is printed on the reverse of a contemporary Indian currency note. SSC CGL 13/04/2022(Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Nepali. Sinhala, is an Indo - Aryan language primarily spoken by the Sinhalese people of Sri Lanka.

question: Who among the following was a saint from Maharashtra? SSC MTS 02/11/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Chokhamela. Dadu Dayal was a poet - saint from Gujarat.

question: For which of the following productions is the Ramagundam power plant famous ? SSC MTS 18/10/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Thermal energy. Ramagundam power plant - It is part of the National Thermal Power Corporation, a 2600 MW power station located in Ramagundam, Telangana.

question: Which of the following is the name of the spacecraft developed by SpaceX for NASA’s manned mission to the International Space Station? SSC MTS 20/10/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Crew Dragon is the name of the spacecraft developed by SpaceX for NASA’s manned mission to the International Space Station. NASA headquarters is in Washington DC.

question: Which is the national heritage animal of India? SSC MTS 22/10/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Elephant (2010). Project Elephant (PE) was launched by the Government of India in the year 1992.

question: Unique Transaction Reference number is a ______ character code used to uniquely identify a transaction in the RTGS system. SSC CGL 13/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 22. Unique Transaction Reference number used to uniquely identify a transaction in the RTGS system. It is used to identify a specific bank transaction in India. All banks in India use UTR numbers for all types of money transfers.

question: Who among the following was the founder of Homeopathy? SSC CGL 13/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Samuel Hahnemann espoused the law of cure known as "Similia Similibus Curentur", or "Like Cures Like".

question: SIMBEX is a military exercise conducted between the defense forces of which of the following nations? SSC CGL 17/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: India and Singapore. India and Thailand (Maitree, CORPAT), India and the US (Vajra Prahar, Yudh Abhyas), India and Sri Lanka (Mitra Shakti).

question: Who among the following is the founder of the field of psychoanalysis? SSC CGL 18/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Sigmund Freud. Carl Jung - Founded analytical psychology. Kai T Erikson - specializing in the social consequences of catastrophic events. Jean Piaget - Worked on child development.

question: Which of the following is the largest sea bird with the longest wingspan? SSC CGL 20/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Wandering Albatross. The maximum dimensions in this species are a length of 1.44 m (4.7 ft) and a wingspan of 3.65 m (12.0 ft).

question: ‘Oolong’ is a variant of ______. SSC CGL 20/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Tea. Oolong - It is a traditional semi-oxidized Chinese tea. It is made from the leaves of the Camellia Sinensis plant. The same plant is used to make Green tea and Black tea.

question: Hakki, Pikki and Siddi are _________ from Karnataka. SSC CHSL 12/04/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Language. These languages ​are critically endangered in Karnataka. Hakki, Pikki and Siddi is a mix of Konkani, Kannada and Hindi. Kannada is the official language of Karnataka.

question: In which year was the Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA) established in India? SSC CHSL 05/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 1972. The Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA) is a statutory body that was established under the Ministry of Commerce and Industry for the promotion of the export of marine products from India.

question: Since 2000, Euro norms are followed in India under the name ______ Stage Emission Standards for four wheeled vehicles. SSC CHSL 06/08/2021 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Bharat. Vehicle emission norms were introduced in India in 1991 for petrol and in 1992 for diesel vehicles.

question: When was the Editors Guild of India founded? SSC CHSL 10/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: 1978. It was established with the twin objectives of protecting press freedom and raising the standards of editorial leadership of newspapers and magazines.

question: Where was the first factory of the Indian Iron and Steel Company (IISCO) set up? SSC CHSL 10/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Hirapur. IISCO Steel Plant of Steel Authority of India Limited is an integrated steel plant located at Hirapur (later to be called Burnpur) in the Asansol subdivision of Paschim Bardhaman district, West Bengal.

question: Where is the Rumi Darwaza located? SSC CHSL 10/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Lucknow. It is an imposing gateway that was built by Nawab Asaf-Ud-Daula in 1784.

question: In the context of forest conservation, Navadanya Movement was founded in 1987 by ______. SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Vandana Shiva. Navdanya is an Indian-based non-governmental organization that promotes biodiversity conservation, biodiversity, organic farming, the rights of farmers, and the process of seed saving.

question: How many windows are there on the outside walls of Hawa Mahal of Jaipur? SSC CHSL 17/03/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: 953. Hawa Mahal of Jaipur was designed by Lal Chand Ustad.

question: In which color are the railway lines and telephone lines shown in the topographic map? SSC CHSL 14/10/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Black - Railroads, boundaries, telephone lines. Brown - Topographic contours. Blue - Lakes, streams, irrigation ditches and other hydrographic features Red - Land grids and important roads.

question: Which of the following was previously known as 'the Lady Willingdon Park'. SSC CGL 03/03/2020 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: Lodhi Garden. Lady Willingdon Park was inaugurated in April 1936.

question: Which ISO certification pertains to Environmental Management Systems? SSC CGL 06/03/2020 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: 14001. ISO 22000 - It is an international standard for food safety established by the International Organization for Standardization.

question: Who designed the logo for Lokpal in India? SSC CGL 09/03/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Prashant Mishra. The logo of Lokpal: LOK - people and PAL - caretaker, i.e. "caretaker of people”.
